So, He harmonized them, and they were not existent in their immutable essences (أعيانها), but He brought them into existence already harmonized. He did not create them separately and then combine them, for their realities reject that. Rather, He created the form, which is the expression of the harmonization of two of these realities. Thus, it is as if they were existent separately and then harmonized, and a reality appeared from the harmonization that did not exist at the time of separation. The realities dictate that these Mothers never had existence in their immutable essences at all before the existence of the forms composed from them. When He created these forms—which are Water, Fire, Air, and Earth—He made them transform into one another, so Fire returns to Air, and Air to Fire, just as the letter Ta (ت) is changed to Ta (ط) and Sin (س) to Sad (ص), because the sphere from which the Primary Mothers originated is the same sphere from which these Letters originated.

### [Spheres of the Elements and Spheres of the Letters]

The sphere from which Earth originated produced the letters Tha (ث) and Ta (ت), excluding the head of Jim (ج), half the curve of Lam (ل), the head of Kha (خ), two-thirds of Ha (ه), the dry Dal (د), Nun (ن), and Mim (م).

The sphere from which Water originated produced the letters Shin (ش), Ghayn (غ), Ta (ط), Ha (ح), Dad (ض), the head of Ba (ب) with its single dot, the length of the body of Fa (ف) without its head, the head of Qaf (ق) and a part of its curve, and the lower half-circle of the dotted Dha (ظ).

The sphere from which Air originated produced the final tip of Ha (ه) that closes its circle, the head of Fa (ف), the curve of Kha (خ) according to the rule of the half-circle, the upper half-circle of the dotted Dha (ظ) with its upright stroke, and the letters Dhal (ذ), Ayn (ع), Zay (ز), Sad (ص), and Waw (و).

The sphere from which Fire originated produced the letters Hamza (ء), Kaf (ك), Ba (ب), Sin (س), Ra (ر), the head of Jim (ج), the body of Ya (ي) with two dots below without its head, the middle of Lam (ل), and the body of Qaf (ق) without its head.

From the reality of Alif (أ) all these Letters originated, and it is their sphere, both spiritually and sensually.

### [The Origin of the Pillars: The Fifth Existent]

Likewise, there is a fifth existent (موجود خامس) which is the origin of these Pillars (الأركان). There is a disagreement about this among the practitioners of natural science based on speculation. The philosopher mentioned it in *Al-Ustuqussat* (The Elements) but did not provide anything conclusive for the observer. I did not learn this from my reading of natural science from its experts. Rather, a friend of mine, who was studying medicine, brought it to me, and he asked me to clarify it for him from the perspective of our knowledge of these things through Unveiling (الكشف), not through reading and speculation. He read it to us, and I became aware of the disagreement I mentioned. Had it not been for that, I would not have known if anyone disagreed about it or not, for we possess only the absolute Truth (الشيء الحق) concerning it, and we have no disagreement.

### [The Readiness to Receive Influxes]

When The Real (الحق تعالى), from whom we receive knowledge, empties the heart of thought (الفكر), the readiness to receive the influxes (الواردات) is what grants us the matter according to its origin, without ambiguity or confusion. Thus, we know the realities as they are, whether they are simple elements or those that occur through composition, or the Divine realities. We do not doubt any of them. That is the source of our knowledge, and The Real, exalted is He, is our Teacher. This is a prophetic inheritance (ورثا نبويا), preserved and infallible.

The Manifest said, exalted is He: <<وَمَا عَلَّمْنَاهُ الشِّعْرَ وَمَا يَنْبَغِي لَهُ>> (And We have not taught him poetry, nor is it appropriate for him). For poetry is the place of ambiguity (الإجمال), symbols (الرموز), riddles (الألغاز), and double meanings (التورية). That is, We did not symbolize anything to him, nor riddle him, nor address him with one thing while intending another, nor did We make the address ambiguous for him. <<إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ>> (It is nothing but a reminder) of what he witnessed when We drew him near, veiled him from himself, and brought him into Our Presence, so that We were his hearing and his sight. Then We returned him to you so that you might be guided by him in the darkness of ignorance and contingency. Thus, We were his tongue with which he addresses you. Then We sent down upon him a reminder (مذكرا) that reminds him of what he witnessed. So, it is a remembrance (ذكر) for him of that, and a Quran (قرآن)—meaning, a collection of things he witnessed in Our Presence, made clear and manifest to him due to his knowledge of the origin of what he witnessed and observed in that most pure and holy proximity (التقريب الأنزه الأقدس) that he attained, peace be upon him. We have a share of this according to the purity of the vessel, the preparation, and the piety.

### [The Dependence of Natures on God in the Existence and Composition of their Essences]

Whoever knows that the natures (الطبائع) and the composite world derived from them are in the utmost need and dependence upon Allah, exalted is He, for the existence of their immutable essences (أعيانها) and their composition, knows that the cause is the realities of the Divine Presence (الحضرة الإلهية), the Beautiful Names, and the Sublime Attributes, acting as they will, according to what their realities impart. We have fully explained this section in *Kitab Insha’ al-Jadawil wal-Dawa’ir*, and we will mention a part of it in this book. This is the primordial Cause of Causes (سبب الأسباب القديم), the harmonizer of the Mothers and the generator of the Daughters. Glory be to the Creator of the earth and the heavens.

(Connection) [On the Simple Elements of the Ranks of Letters according to the Verifiers]

The required discussion in this book concerning the Letters has concluded regarding the Charged One (Allah) and the charged beings (Creation), their share of the Letters, their movement in the sixfold doubled spheres, the determination of the years of their cycle in those spheres, their share of nature from the movement of those spheres, and their four ranks in the Charged One and the charged beings according to the understanding of the general populace (العامة). For this reason, the spheres of their Simple Elements are of two types.

The Simple Elements that are confined to the realities of the general intellect are four: the Letters of The Real (الحق) from the sevenfold spheres, the Letters of the Human from the eightfold, the Letters of the Angel from the ninefold, and the Letters of the fiery Jinn from the tenfold. There is no additional division according to them due to their inability to perceive what lies beyond, as they are under the compulsion of their intellects. The Verifiers (المحققون), however, are under the compulsion of their Master, The Real King, exalted is He. For this reason, they possess Unveiling (الكشف) that others do not.

The Simple Elements of the Verifiers are of six ranks:

1.  A rank for the Charged One, The Real, exalted is He, which is Nun (ن). It is binary (ثنائية), for The Real is only known to us through us—He is our Worshipped—and He is not known perfectly except through us. For this reason, He has the Nun, which is binary, for its simple elements are two: Waw (و) and Alif (أ). Alif is for Him, and Waw is for your meaning, as you are the Vicegerent (الخليفة). For this reason, Alif is general, and Waw is mixed, as will be mentioned later in this chapter when we discuss the Letters individually. The specific cycle of this sphere, by which it cuts the total encompassing sphere, is a comprehensive cycle that cuts the total sphere in eighty-two thousand years. The sphere of Waw cuts the total sphere in ten thousand years, as we will mention later in this chapter.
2.  The remaining ranks correspond to the number of charged beings. The second rank is for the Human, who is the most perfect of the charged beings in existence, the most comprehensive and complete in creation, and the most upright. It has one letter, Mim (م). It is ternary (ثلاثية), for its simple elements are three: Ya (ي), Alif (أ), and Hamza (ء). This will be mentioned later in the chapter, God willing.
3.  The third rank is for the Jinn absolutely (luminous and fiery). It is quaternary (رباعية). Its letters are Jim, Waw, Kaf, and Qaf. This will be mentioned later.
4.  The fourth rank is for the Animals (البهائم). It is quinary (خماسية). Its letters are the dry Dal, Zay, the dry Sad, the dry Ayn, the dotted Dad, the dry Sin, the dotted Dhal, Ghayn, and the dotted Shin. This will be mentioned later, God willing.
5.  The fifth rank is for the Plants (النبات). It is senary (سداسية). Its letters are Alif, Ha, and Lam. This will be mentioned later, God willing.
6.  The sixth rank is for the Inanimate/Mineral (الجماد). It is septenary (سباعية). Its letters are Ba, Ha, Ta, Ya, Fa, Ra, Ta, Tha, Kha, and Dha. This will be mentioned later, God willing.

The purpose of this book is to reveal flashes and glimpses of the secrets of Existence (أسرار الوجود). If we were to open the discussion on the inner secrets of these Letters and what their realities necessitate, the right hand would tire, the pen would wear out, the ink would dry up, and the papers and tablets would be insufficient, even if they were the unrolled parchment (الرق المنشور), for they are among the Words (الكلمات) concerning which Allah said: <<لَوْ كَانَ الْبَحْرُ مِدَادًا>> (If the sea were ink), and <<وَلَوْ أَنَّ مَا فِي الْأَرْضِ مِنْ شَجَرَةٍ أَقْلَامٌ وَالْبَحْرُ يَمُدُّهُ مِنْ بَعْدِهِ سَبْعَةُ أَبْحُرٍ مَا نَفِدَتْ كَلِمَاتُ اللَّهِ>> (And if whatever trees on earth were pens and the sea [were ink], supplemented by seven more seas, the Words of Allah would not be exhausted). There is a secret and a wondrous indication here that has not been noticed by those who encountered these Words.

If these sciences were the result of thought and speculation, the human would be confined within the shortest time. But they are influxes (موارد) from The Real, exalted is He, that continuously flow upon the servant's heart, and the pure spirits descend upon them from His unseen world by His Mercy that is from Him and His Knowledge that is from His Presence (لدنه). The Real, exalted is He, is the Perpetual Giver (وهاب), the Continuous Effuser (فياض), and the vessel is perpetually receptive. It either accepts ignorance or accepts knowledge. If the servant prepares himself, purifies the mirror of his heart, and polishes it, he receives the gift continuously. In a single moment, he receives what he cannot record over long periods, due to the vastness of that intelligible sphere and the narrowness of this sensible sphere. How can that which has no conceivable end or limit cease?

This was explicitly stated in His command to His Messenger, peace be upon him: <<وَقُلْ رَبِّ زِدْنِي عِلْمًا>> (And say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge"). The intended increase is in the knowledge related to the Deity (الإله), so that his Gnosis (معرفة) of the unity of multiplicity (توحيد الكثرة) increases, thereby increasing his desire to praise Him, and thus increasing his merit through his praise, without end or interruption. He asked for increase, having already attained knowledge and secrets that no one else reached.

What supports our statement that he was commanded to increase in the knowledge of Unity (التوحيد) and not other knowledge is that when he ate food, peace be upon him, he would say: "O Allah, bless us in it and feed us better than it." But when he drank milk, he said: "O Allah, bless us in it and increase us from it." Because he was commanded to seek increase, he remembered this when he saw the milk he drank on the night of the Ascension (الإسراء), and Gabriel said to him: "You have attained the primordial nature (الفطرة). May Allah cause your community to attain it through you."

The primordial nature (الفطرة) is the knowledge of Unity upon which Allah created mankind when He made them witness, when He took them from their loins: <<أَلَسْتُ بِرَبِّكُمْ قَالُوا بَلَىٰ>> (Am I not your Lord? They said, "Yes"). Thus, they witnessed Lordship (الربوبية) before everything else. For this reason,

the Prophet, peace be upon him, interpreted the milk when he drank it in the dream and gave the remainder to Umar. When asked, "How did you interpret it, O Messenger of Allah?" he said, "Knowledge (العلم)."

If there were not a suitable reality combining Knowledge and Milk, it would not have appeared in the form of milk in the world of Imagination (عالم الخيال). This is known by those who know it and ignored by those who ignore it. How can the speech of one who takes from Allah, not from himself, ever end? Great is the difference between an author who says, "So-and-so narrated to me, may Allah have mercy on him, from so-and-so, may Allah have mercy on him," and one who says, "My heart narrated to me from my Lord (حدثني قلبي عن ربي)." And even though this is of high rank, great is the difference between him and one who says, "My Lord narrated to me from my Lord (حدثني ربي عن ربي)"—meaning, my Lord narrated to me from Himself. The first refers to the Lord who is believed in (the conditioned Lord), and the second refers to the Lord who is unconditioned (الرب الذي لا يتقيد). Thus, the latter is without mediation, while the former is with mediation. This is the knowledge that the heart receives from the Essential Witnessing (المشاهدة الذاتية), from which it flows onto the innermost secret (السر), the Spirit (الروح), and the Soul (النفس).

How can the spiritual path of one whose source is this be known? You cannot know him until you know Allah, and just as He, exalted is He, is not known from all aspects of Gnosis, so too this person is not known, for the intellect does not know where he is, since his object of desire is the contingent worlds (الأكوان), and he has no contingent world, as was said:

> You appeared when I was left after my annihilation (فنائه),
> So existence was without contingency, because you were it.

Praise be to Allah, who made me one of the People of Imparting (الإلقاء) and Receiving (التلقي). We ask Him, exalted is He, to make us and you among the People of Nearness (التداني) and Ascent (الترقي).

Then I return and say that the sections on the letters of the alphabet exceed five hundred sections, and in every section there are many ranks. We have left the discussion of them so that we may fully cover it in *Kitab al-Mabadi wal-Ghayat*, God willing. We shall confine ourselves here to what must be mentioned after naming the ranks appropriate for this book. Perhaps we will discuss some of them, and after that, we will take them letter by letter until all the letters are complete, God willing. Then we will follow that with indications of the secrets of the embrace of Lam (ل) with Alif (أ) and its adherence to it, and the reason for this spiritual love (التعشق الروحاني) between them specifically, such that it appeared in the world of writing and inscription. For in the connection of Lam with Alif there is a secret that is not unveiled except to one who raises the Alif from its slumber and unties the Lam from its knot. May Allah guide us and you to righteous deeds that He approves of us. End of Part Four, and praise be to Allah.

### "Mention of Some Ranks of the Letters"

(In the Name of Allah, the Most Compassionate, the Most Merciful) Know—may Allah grant us and you success—that the Letters are a nation (أمة) among the nations, addressed and charged (مكلفون). Among them are messengers from their own kind, and they have Names from the perspective of their being. Only the People of Unveiling (أهل الكشف) from our path know this. The world of Letters is the most eloquent world in speech and the clearest in expression. They are divided into categories like the known categories of the Cosmos in common usage:

1.  **The World of Compulsion (عالم الجبروت)** (according to Abu Talib al-Makki, which we call the World of Magnificence - عالم العظمة): Ha (ه) and Hamza (ء).
2.  **The Highest World (العالم الأعلى)** (the World of Sovereignty - عالم الملكوت): Ha (ح), Kha (خ), Ayn (ع), and Ghayn (غ).
3.  **The Middle World (العالم الوسط)** (the World of Compulsion - عالم الجبروت according to us and most of our companions): Ta, Tha, Jim, Dal, Dhal, Ra, Zay, Dha, Kaf, Lam, Nun, Sad, Dad, Qaf, Sin, Shin, and the sound Ya (ي).
4.  **The Lowest World (العالم الأسفل)** (the World of Dominion and Witnessing - عالم الملك والشهادة): Ba, Mim, and the sound Waw (و).
5.  **The Mixed World** (between the World of Witnessing and the Middle World): Fa (ف).
6.  **The World of Mixture** (between the Middle World of Compulsion and the World of Sovereignty): Kaf (ك) and Qaf (ق). The letters Ta, Dha, Sad, and Dad mix with them in spiritual attribute (الصفة الروحانية).
7.  **The World of Mixture** (between the Greatest World of Compulsion and the World of Sovereignty): The unpointed Ha (ح).
8.  **The World that Resembles the World of those among us** who are neither described by entering into us nor by exiting from us: Alif, Ya, and Waw (the weak/vowel letters).

These are worlds, and each world has a messenger from its own kind, and they have a law (شريعة) by which they worship. They have subtleties (لطائف) and densities (كثائف). The address directed to them is only a command (الأمر); they have no prohibition (نهي). Among them are the general populace (عامة), the elite (خاصة), and the elite of the elite (خاصة الخاصة).

*   **The General Populace:** Jim, Dad, Kha, Dal, Ghayn, and Shin.
*   **The Elite of the Elite:** Alif, Ya, Ba, Sin, Kaf, Ta, Qaf, Ta, Waw, Sad, Ha, Nun, Lam, and Ghayn.
*   **The Essence of the Elite of the Elite (خلاصة خاصة الخاصة):** Ba (ب).
*   **The Elite (one degree above the general populace):** The letters at the beginning of the Surahs (أوائل السور), such as Alif Lam Mim (الم) and Alif Lam Mim Sad (المص). These are fourteen letters: Alif, Lam, Mim, Sad, Ra, Kaf, Ha, Ya, Ayn, Ta, Sin, Ha, Qaf, and Nun.
*   **The Pure Letters of the Essence of the Elite of the Elite:** Nun, Mim, Ra, Ba, Dal, Zay, Alif, Ta, Ya, Waw, Ha, Dha, Tha, Lam, Fa, and Sin.
*   **The Sent World (العالم المرسل):** Jim, Ha, Kha, and Kaf.
*   **The World that is related to Allah and to which Creation is related:** Alif, Dal, Dhal, Ra, Zay, and Waw. This is the World of Sanctification (عالم التقديس) of the Cherubic Letters (الكروبيين).
*   **The World dominated by assuming the Attributes of The Real (التخلق بأوصاف الحق):** Ta, Tha, Ha, Dhal, Zay, the dotted Dha, Nun, the dotted Dad, the dotted Ghayn, Qaf, the dotted Shin, and Fa (according to the People of Lights - أهل الأنوار).
*   **The World dominated by Realization (التحقق):** Ba, Fa (according to the People of Secrets - أهل الأسرار), and Jim.
*   **The World that has realized the station of Union (الاتحاد):** Alif, Ha, Dal, Ra, the dry Ta, Kaf, Lam, Mim, the dry Sad, Ayn, the dry Sin, Ha, and Waw. However, I say they are at two stations in Union: High and Highest. The High are Alif, Kaf, Mim, Ayn, and Sin. The Highest are the rest.
*   **The World of Mixed Natures (الممتزج الطبائع):** Jim, Ha, Ya, Lam, Fa, Qaf, Kha, and Dha specifically.

The genera of the worlds of Letters are four:

1.  **Simple Genus (جنس مفرد):** Alif, Kaf, Lam, Mim, Ha, Nun, and Waw.
2.  **Binary Genus (جنس ثنائي):** Dal and Dhal.
3.  **Ternary Genus (جنس ثلاثي):** Jim, Ha, and Kha.
4.  **Quaternary Genus (جنس رباعي):** Ba, Ta, Tha, Ya (in the middle of the word), and Nun (which is quinary in this respect, but if you do not consider them, Ba, Ta, and Tha are ternary, and the quaternary genus is dropped).

By this, we have recounted to you from the world of Letters what, if you employ yourself in the matters leading to the unveiling of the Cosmos and the observation of its realities, you will realize His saying, exalted is He: <<وَإِنْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ إِلَّا يُسَبِّحُ بِحَمْدِهِ وَلَكِنْ لَا تَفْقَهُونَ تَسْبِيحَهُمْ>> (And there is not a thing except that it glorifies Him with praise, but you do not understand their glorification). If their glorification were merely a state (تسبيح حال), as some speculative scholars claim, there would be no benefit in His saying: <<وَلَكِنْ لَا تَفْقَهُونَ>> (but you do not understand).

I had mentioned that I might discuss some of them. I looked at these worlds to see which one allowed for more extensive discussion than others, and I found it to be the specialized world, which is the world of the unknown openings of the Surahs (أوائل السور المجهولة), such as Alif Lam Mim (الم) of Al-Baqara and Alif Lam Mim Sad (المص). Let us speak briefly about Alif Lam Mim of Al-Baqara, which is the first ambiguous Surah in the Quran, from the path of secrets. Perhaps I will attach to it the verses that follow, even though that is not part of this chapter, but I do it by the command of my Lord, which I have been entrusted with. I only speak by way of permission (الإذن), just as I will stop when a limit is set for me.

For this composition of ours, and others like it, does not follow the course of ordinary compositions, nor do we follow the course of ordinary authors in it. Every author is under his own choice—even if he is compelled in his choice—or under the knowledge that he specifically disseminates, imparting what he wills and withholding what he wills, or imparting what knowledge grants him, and the issue he is addressing dictates to him until its reality is manifested. We are not like that in our compositions. Rather, our hearts are devoted to the door of the Divine Presence (الحضرة الإلهية), observing what is opened to them, poor and empty of all knowledge. If one were to ask in that station about anything, one would not hear, due to the loss of sensation. Whatever matter appears to the heart from behind that veil, it hastens to comply and composes it according to the limit set for it in the command. Sometimes, something is imparted to what is not of its kind, contrary to custom, intellectual speculation, apparent knowledge, and obvious correspondence for scholars, due to a hidden correspondence that only the People of Unveiling perceive. Indeed, there is something even stranger with us: things are imparted to this heart, and it is commanded to convey them, yet it does not know them at that time, due to a Divine wisdom hidden from creation. For this reason, not every person who composes based on Imparting is restricted by the knowledge of that chapter he is speaking about, but he may include other things, which, to the ordinary listener, seem unrelated, but to us, they are definitely from the very essence of that chapter, but in a way known only to us, like the dove and the crow that met due to a limp in their legs. I have been given permission to record what I impart after this, so it must be done.

### "Connection" [On the Discussion of Alif Lam Mim (الم) of Al-Baqara from the Path of Secrets]

The discussion of these specialized unknown Letters covers their number with repetition, their number without repetition, their totality in the Surahs, their singularity (in Sad, Qaf, and Nun), their duality (in Ta Sin and Ta Ha and their sisters), and their combination from three letters upwards until they reach five connected and disconnected letters. It covers why they did not exceed five, why some are connected and some disconnected, why the Surahs are named with Sin (س) and not Sad (ص), and why the meaning of these Letters is unknown to exoteric scholars and to the unveiling of the People of States (أهل الأحوال), and other matters we mentioned in *Kitab al-Jam’ wal-Tafsil fi Ma’rifat Ma’ani al-Tanzil* (The Book of Combination and Detail in the Knowledge of the Meanings of Revelation).

Let us speak with the blessing of Allah, and <<وَاللَّهُ يَقُولُ الْحَقَّ وَهُوَ يَهْدِي السَّبِيلَ>> (And Allah speaks the truth, and He guides to the way).

Know that the beginnings of the unknown Surahs (مبادي السور المجهولة) are only known in their reality by the People of Intelligible Forms (أهل الصور المعقولة). The Surahs of the Quran were named with Sin (س) because it represents the legal servitude (التعبد الشرعي), which is the exoteric aspect of the Surahs containing punishment (العذاب) and ignorance (الجهل) concerning them. Their esoteric aspect is with Sad (ص), which is the station of Mercy (الرحمة) and is nothing but the knowledge of their realities, which is Unity (التوحيد).

The Blessed and Exalted made them twenty-nine Surahs, which is the perfection of the Form (الصورة), and <<وَالْقَمَرَ قَدَّرْنَاهُ مَنَازِلَ>> (And the moon, We have determined for it phases). The twenty-ninth is the Pole (القطب) by which the sphere is sustained, and it is the cause of its existence—it is the Surah Alif Lam Mim Allah (الم الله) of Al Imran. Were it not for that, the twenty-eight would not be established.

The total number of letters, with repetition, is seventy-eight letters. The number eight is the reality of *biḍ'* (بضع - odd number between 3 and 9). The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Faith is seventy-odd (*biḍ'*) branches." These Letters are seventy-eight letters.

A servant does not perfect the secrets of faith until he knows the realities (حقائق) of these letters in their chapters (suras). If you say that *al-bid'* (the few/some, referring to the number mentioned in the verse) is unknown in the language, as it ranges from one to nine, how did you definitively fix it at eight? If you wish, I will tell you that I reached it through the path of Unveiling (الكشف), for it is the path I follow and the pillar upon which I rely in all my sciences. And if you wish, I will show you a part of it from the chapter of Number Science, even though Abu al-Hakam Abd al-Salam ibn Barrajān did not mention it in his book from this chapter we are discussing. Rather, may Allah have mercy on him, he mentioned it from the perspective of astronomy (علم الفلك) and made it a veil over his own unveiling (كشفه) when he definitively predicted the conquest of Jerusalem in the year five hundred and eighty-three (583 AH). Likewise, if we wish, we unveil it, and if we wish, we make the number a veil (حجاب) over that. So we say that *al-bid'* in Sūrat al-Rūm is eight. Take the numerical value of the letters *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) using the minor calculation (الجزم الصغير), which is eight. Add this to the eight of *al-bid'*, making sixteen. Remove the one belonging to the *Alif* for the foundation (للاس), leaving fifteen. Keep this number aside. Then return to the calculation using the major calculation (الجمل الكبير), which is the *Jazm*. Multiply the eight of *al-bid'* by seventy-one, and consider the result as years. The multiplication yields five hundred and sixty-eight (568). Add to this the fifteen that I instructed you to set aside, making five hundred and eighty-three (583) years. This is the time of the conquest of Jerusalem, according to the reading of those who read *ghulibat al-Rūm* (The Byzantines were defeated) with a *fatḥa* on the *ghayn* and *lām*, and *sayughlabūn* (they will be defeated) with a *ḍamma* on the *yā’* and a *fatḥa* on the *lām*. And in the year five hundred and eighty-three (583 AH) was the manifestation of the Muslims in taking the barrier of the disbelievers, which is the conquest of Jerusalem. We possess marvelous secrets in the science of number (علم العدد) derived from the path of Unveiling (الكشف), both through what its nature requires and through the Divine Realities (الحقائق الإلهية) it holds. If our life is prolonged, I shall dedicate a book solely to the knowledge of number, God willing.

Let us return to our original topic. We say that a servant does not perfect the secrets contained within the branches of faith unless he knows the realities (حقائق) of these letters according to their repetition in the suras. Just as, if he knows them without repetition, he knows Allah’s warning within them regarding the Reality of Origination (حقيقة الإيجاد) and the singularity of the Eternal (القديم), glory be to Him, through His eternal Attributes (صفاته الأزلية). Thus, He sent them down in His Qur’an as fourteen isolated, ambiguous letters. He assigned eight for the knowledge of the Essence (الذات) and seven for the Attributes (الصفات) from us. He assigned four for the composite natures (الطبائع المؤلفة), which are blood, black bile, yellow bile, and phlegm. This results in twelve existing things. This is the human being (الإنسان) from this sphere, and from another sphere, he is composed of eleven, ten, nine, and eight, down to the sphere of the Two. He never dissolves into the Oneness (الأحدية), for that belongs exclusively to The Real (الحق) and cannot belong to any existent thing except Him.

Then, glory be to Him, He made the *Alif* the first of them in writing and the *Hamza* in pronunciation, and the *Nūn* the last. The *Alif* signifies the existence of the Essence (الذات) in its perfection, because it is not dependent upon movement. The *Nūn* signifies the existence of half of the cosmos, which is the world of composition (عالم التركيب), and this is the visible half-circle of the sphere (فلك) to us. The other half is the intelligible *Nūn* (النون المعقولة) upon it, which, if it were to appear to the senses and transition from the world of the Spirit (عالم الروح), would form an encompassing circle. However, He concealed this spiritual *Nūn* (النون الروحانية), through which the perfection of Existence (كمال الوجود) is achieved, and the visible dot of the *Nūn* was made to indicate it. Thus, the *Alif* is perfect in all its aspects, and the *Nūn* is deficient. The sun is perfect, and the moon is deficient because it is subject to effacement (*maḥw*). The quality of its light is borrowed—it is the Trust (الأمانة) that it bore. And according to the measure of its effacement and concealment is its affirmation and manifestation: three for three. The three are the setting of the Divine Heart-Moon (القمر القلبي الإلهي) in the Presence of Oneness (الحضرة الأحدية), and the three are the rising of the Divine Moon in the Lordly Presence (الحضرة الربانية). What lies between them in the going forth and the return is step by step, never failing.

Then, glory be to Him, He established these letters upon levels (مراتب): some are connected (*mawṣūl*), some are separated (*maqṭū‘*), some are singular (*mufrad*), dual (*mathnā*), and plural (*majmū‘*). Then He warned that in every connection there is a separation, but not in every separation is there a connection. Every connection indicates a division, but not every division indicates a connection. Connection and separation exist in the state of Gathering (*al-Jam‘*) and outside of Gathering, but separation alone exists in the very essence of Differentiation (*‘ayn al-Farq*). That which He made singular (الإفراد) among these is an indication of the annihilation (*fanā’*) of the servant’s trace eternally. That which He made dual (المثنى) is an indication of the existence of the trace of servanthood (*‘ubūdiyya*) presently. That which He made plural (الجمع) is an indication of eternity (الأبد) through the inexhaustible resources. Thus, singularity is for the Eternal Sea (البحر الأزلي), plurality is for the Everlasting Sea (البحر الأبدي), and duality is for the Muhammadan Isthmus (البرزخ المحمدي), the Human. <<He has released the two seas meeting [side by side]; between them is an isthmus (برزخ) which neither transgresses. So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?>> Is it by the Sea to which He connected him, annihilating him from the Fixed Entities (الأعيان), or by the Sea from which He separated him and named the created worlds (الأكوان), or by the Isthmus (البرزخ) upon which the All-Merciful established Himself? <<So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?>> From the Sea of Eternity (بحر الأزل) comes forth the <<pearls (اللُّؤْلُؤُ)>> and from the Sea of Everlastingness (بحر الأبد) comes forth the <<coral (الْمَرْجانُ)>>. <<So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?>> <<And to Him belong the spiritual ships (الْجَوارِ الروحانية), created from the Nomadic Realities (الحقائق الأسمائية) in the Most Holy Essential Sea (الْبَحْرِ الذاتي الأقدسي), like mountains (كَالْأَعْلامِ)>>. <<So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?>> The higher world, despite its elevation and sanctity, and the lower world, despite its descent and misfortune, ask Him. <<Every day He is in [new] splendor>>. <<So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?>> <<Everyone upon the earth will perish (كُلُّ مَنْ عَلَيْها فانٍ)>>, even if the Fixed Entities (الأعيان) are not annihilated, but it is a journey from one who is near to one who is nearer. <<So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?>> <<We will attend to you, O prominent beings (أَيُّهَ الثَّقَلانِ)>>. <<So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?>>

Thus, if the Qur’an were contemplated, no two people would disagree, no two adversaries would appear, and no two goats would butt heads. Therefore, contemplate your verses and do not depart from your Essence (ذاتكم); if you must depart, then let it be to your Attributes (صفاتكم). For when the cosmos is safe from your observation and management, it is truly under your subjugation. For this purpose, He created it. He, the Exalted, said: <<And He has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth—all from Him>>. May Allah guide us and you to that which contains our righteousness and happiness in this world and the Hereafter. Indeed, He is a Generous Protector.

Section [Continuation of the Discourse on *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) and *That is the Book* (ذلِكَ الْكِتابُ) from the Path of Secrets]

The *Alif* of *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) is an indication of Unity (التوحيد), and the *Mīm* is for the Dominion (الملك) that does not perish, and the *Lām* between them is an intermediary to be a link between the two. Look at the line upon which the stroke of the *Lām* falls: you will find that the origin of the *Alif* ends there, and the growth of the *Mīm* begins from it. Then you descend from the fairest stature (أحسن تقويم), which is the line, to the lowest of the low (أسفل سافلين), which is the end of the curve of the *Mīm*. The Exalted said: <<We have certainly created the human being (الْإِنْسانَ) in the best of stature (أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ); then We return him to the lowest of the low (أَسْفَلَ سافِلِينَ)>>. The descent of the *Alif* to the line is like His saying, "Our Lord descends to the lowest heaven (السماء الدنيا)," which is the beginning of the world of composition (عالم التركيب), because it is the heaven of Adam, peace be upon him, followed by the sphere of Fire. Therefore, it descends to the beginning of the line. This descent is from the Station of Oneness (مقام الأحدية) to the Station of the Origination of Creation (إيجاد الخليقة)—a descent of sanctification and transcendence (تنزيه), not a descent of similitude and anthropomorphism (تمثيل وتشبيه).

The *Lām* was the intermediary, standing in the place of the Originator (*al-Mukawwin*) and the Created (*al-Kawn*). It is the Power (القدرة) through which the cosmos came into existence. Thus, it resembled the *Alif* in descending to the beginning of the line. Since it is mixed from the Originator and the Created, He is not described by Power over Himself, but rather He is Powerful over His creation. Thus, the face of Power is directed toward creation. For this reason, the Creator is only affirmed through creation, so His Power must necessarily relate to them, both high and low. Since its reality is not completed by reaching the line—which would place it and the *Alif* on the same level—it sought, by its reality, to descend below the line or upon the line, just as the *Mīm* descended. So it descended to the origination of the *Mīm*, but it could not descend in the form of the *Mīm*, so only the *Mīm* could ever be originated from it. Thus, it descended as a half-circle until it reached the line from a direction other than the one from which it descended. It became a sensible half-sphere (فلك محسوس) seeking an intelligible half-sphere (فلك معقول). From the two of them came a revolving sphere. Thus, the entire cosmos, from its beginning to its end, was formed in six days, categorized from the first day, Sunday, to the last day, Friday. Saturday remained for transitions from state (*ḥāl*) to state, from station (*maqām*) to station, and transformations from existence (*kawn*) to existence, remaining fixed upon that, never departing or changing. For this reason, the ruler over this day is coldness and dryness, and among the planets, it is Saturn (*Zuḥal*).

Thus, *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) alone became an encompassing sphere (فلكا محيطا). Whoever revolves within it knows the Essence (الذات), the Attributes (الصفات), the Acts (الأفعال), and the Effects (*al-Maf‘ūlāt*). Whoever recites *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) with this Reality (الحقيقة) and Unveiling (الكشف) is present with the All, for the All, and alongside the All. Nothing remains at that time except that he witnesses it (يشهده), though some of it is known and some is unknown. The transcendence (*tanzīh*) of the *Alif* from being sustained by movements indicates that the Attributes (الصفات) are only intelligible through the Acts (الأفعال), as the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Allah was, and there was nothing with Him, and He is now as He was." For this reason, we direct the matter toward what is intelligible, not toward His transcendent Essence (ذاته المنزهة). For relation (*al-iḍāfa*) is never intelligible except through the correlatives. Fatherhood, for instance, is not intelligible except through the father and the son, whether in existence or in estimation. The same applies to the Owner, the Creator, the Maker, the Fashioner, and all the Names (الأسماء) that seek the cosmos through their realities. The point of warning regarding these matters in the letters *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) lies in the connection of the *Lām*, which is the Attribute (الصفة), with the *Mīm*, which is its effect and Act (فعلها).

The *Alif* is a singular Essence (ذات واحدة). No letter can properly connect to it when it occurs first in writing. It is the Straight Path (الصراط المستقيم) that the soul asks for in its saying: <<Guide us to the Straight Path (اهْدِنَا الصِّراطَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ)>>—the path of Transcendence (التنزيه) and Unity (التوحيد). When the soul said *Āmīn* to its supplication to its Lord, who is the Word (الكلمة) to whom it was commanded to return in Sūrat al-Fajr, the Exalted accepted its *Āmīn* to its supplication. Thus, He manifested the *Alif* of *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) immediately following <<nor of those who go astray (ولا الضَّالِّينَ)>> and concealed *Āmīn*, because it is a mystery (*ghayb*) from the World of the Divine Kingdom (عالم الملكوت). Whoever’s *Āmīn* corresponds to the *Āmīn* of the angels in the verified Unseen (الغيب المتحقق)—which the common jurists call Sincerity (*al-Ikhlāṣ*), the Sufis call Presence (*al-Ḥuḍūr*), the Verifiers (*al-Muḥaqqiqūn*) call Spiritual Aspiration (*al-Himma*), and which I and those like me call Divine Care (*al-‘Ināya*). Since the *Alif* is unified in the World of the Divine Kingdom (الملكوت) and the World of Witnessing (الشهادة), it appeared, and thus the distinction between the Eternal (القديم) and the originated (*al-muḥdath*) occurred. Look into what we have written, and you will see wonders.

What supports what we have mentioned is the existence of the Attribute of prolongation (*al-madd*) found in the *Lām* and the *Mīm*, but not in the *Alif*. If a Sufi says, "We find the *Alif* written, but the pronunciation is with the *Hamza*, not the *Alif*. Why is the *Alif* not pronounced?" We reply: This also supports what we have said. The *Alif* does not accept movement (*ḥaraka*). A letter is unknown unless it is moved; when moved, it is distinguished by the movement related to it, whether *raf‘* (raising), *naṣb* (setting), or *khafḍ* (lowering). The Essence (الذات) is never known as it truly is. The *Alif*, which indicates the Essence and is the vicegerent (*khalīfa*) in the world of letters, just as the human is in the cosmos, is also unknown, like the Essence. It does not accept movement. Since it does not accept it, it remains only to be known by negating descriptions from it. Since it is impossible to pronounce a quiescent letter, we pronounce the name of the *Alif*, not the *Alif* itself. Thus, we pronounce the *Hamza* with the *fatḥa* (opening) movement. The *Hamza* stands in the place of the First Originator (*al-Mubdi’ al-Awwal*), and its movement is His Attribute of Knowledge (صفته العلمية), and the locus of its origination is in the connection of the *Kāf* with the *Nūn*.

If it is said, "We find the *Alif* in the *Lām* pronounced, but we do not find it in the *Alif* itself," we say: You speak truly. It is only pronounced when preceded by a letter that is fully moved and connected to it. Our discussion concerns the separated *Alif* (الألف المقطوعة) whose preceding letter’s movement is not fully satisfied, so it does not appear in pronunciation, even if it is written, such as the *Alif* in <<Indeed, the believers (إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ)>>. These are two *Alifs* between the *Mīm* of *innamā* and the *Lām* of *al-mu’minūn*, existing in writing but not articulated in pronunciation. The connected *Alif* (الألف الموصولة) that occurs after a letter, such as the *Lām*, *Hā’*, *Ḥā’*, and their like—were it not for its existence, there would be no prolongation (*madd*) for any of these letters. Its prolongation is the secret of seeking sustenance (*sirr al-istimdād*) through which the Attributes (الصفات) are originated in the locus of the letters. For this reason, prolongation only occurs through connection. When a letter is connected to the *Alif* of its other name, the *Alif* is prolonged by the existence of the connected letter. When the connected letter came into existence, it was in need of the Attribute of the All-Merciful (الصفة الرحمانية), so it was given the movement of opening, which is the *fatḥa*. When it was given this, it was asked to show gratitude for it. It asked, "How can I show gratitude for it?" It was told: "By informing the listeners that your existence and the existence of your attribute were not by yourself, but rather from the Essence (ذات) of the Exalted Eternal. So mention Him when you mention yourself, for He has made you, specifically through the Attribute of Mercy, a proof (دليلا) of Him." For this reason, it is said that Allah created Adam upon the form of the All-Merciful (صورة الرحمن). Thus, it spoke in praise of its Originator, saying *Lām*, *Yā’*, *Hā’*, *Ḥā’*, *Ṭā’*. It manifested in pronunciation what was concealed in writing, because the *Alif* in *Ṭā-Hā*, *Ḥā-Mīm*, and *Ṭā-Sīn* exists in pronunciation but is concealed in writing, due to the Attribute indicating it, which is the *fatḥa*, the Attribute of the Opening of Existence (افتتاح الوجود).

If it is said, "We also find prolongation (*madd*) in the *Wāw* preceded by a *ḍamma* (closing) and the *Yā’* preceded by a *kasra* (lowering). These are also three essences (ذوات), so how can this be, when there is only one Essence?" We reply: Yes. The prolongation found in the *Wāw* preceded by a *ḍamma*—such as the *Nūn* and the Pen (ن والقلم)—and the *Yā’* preceded by a *kasra*—such as the *Yā’* of *Ṭā-Sīn* and the *Yā’* of the *Mīm* in *Ḥā-Mīm*—is because Allah, the Exalted, made them letters of causality (*ḥurūf ‘illa*). Every cause, by its reality, calls for its effect. When it calls for that, there must be a secret between them through which seeking sustenance (*istimdād*) and providing sustenance (*imdād*) occur. For this reason, they were given prolongation. This is because when the angelic Messenger (الرسول الملكي) was entrusted with the Revelation (*al-waḥy*), had there not been some relation between him and the one who cast it upon him, he would not have accepted anything, but this was concealed from him. When he received the Revelation, his station was the *Wāw*, because he is spiritual and elevated, and the *raf‘* (raising) denotes elevation, which is the door of the causal *Wāw*. Thus, we refer to him as the spiritual angelic Messenger, whether Gabriel or another angel. When the human Messenger (الرسول البشري) was entrusted with the secrets of Unity (التوحيد) and the Divine Laws (*al-Sharā’i‘*), he was given the seeking and providing of sustenance (الاستمداد والإمداد) by which the world of composition (عالم التركيب) is sustained, yet the secret of seeking sustenance was concealed from him. For this reason, he said: <<I do not know what will be done with me or with you>> and he said: <<I am only a human being like you>>. Since he exists in the lower world, the world of body and composition, we assigned him the causal *Yā’* preceded by a *kasra* (lowering), which is one of the letters of *khafḍ* (lowering). Since both were causes for the existence of the Divine Secrets, including Unity and Law, they were granted the secret of seeking sustenance, and thus they were prolonged.

As for the difference between them and the *Alif*: the *Wāw* and the *Yā’* may be stripped of this station and moved by all movements, such as His saying: <<And He found you (وَوَجَدَكَ)>>, *tu’wī*, *wallaw al-adbār*, *yan’awna*, *yughnīhi*, <<Indeed, you are to die (إِنَّكَ مَيِّتٌ)>>. They may also be quiescent with the living quiescence, such as His saying: <<And he is not to die (وما هُوَ بِمَيِّتٍ)>>, *yan’awna*, and their like. However, the *Alif* is never moved, and the letter preceding it is never found except with a *fatḥa* (opening). Therefore, there is no relation between the *Alif* and the *Wāw* and *Yā’*. Whenever the *Wāw* and *Yā’* are moved, that is their station and part of their attributes. Whenever they are joined to the *Alif* in causality, that is not from their essence (ذاتها), but rather from the side of the Eternal (القديم), glory be to Him, who neither bears nor accepts movement. Rather, that causality stems from the attribute and reality of the station to which the *Wāw* and *Yā’* descended. Thus, the signified of the *Alif* is Eternal (قديم), while the *Wāw* and *Yā’*, whether moved or not moved, are originated (*ḥādith*). If this is established, then every *Alif*, *Wāw*, or *Yā’* that is written or pronounced is merely a proof (*dalīl*). Every originated proof requires an originated thing, and the originated thing is not encompassed by writing or pronunciation; rather, it is a manifest mystery (*ghayb ẓāhir*). Likewise, *Yā-Sīn* (يس) and *Nūn* (ن): we find them in pronunciation, which is their manifestation, but we do not find them in writing, which is their mystery (*ghayb*). This is the reason for attaining knowledge of the existence of the Creator, not His Essence (ذاته), through the existence of <<There is nothing like unto Him (لَيْسَ كَمِثْلِهِ شَيْ‏ءٌ)>>, not through His Essence.

Know, O recipient, that everything that falls under limitation is originated (*mubda‘*) or created (*makhlūq*), and that is your locus. Therefore, do not seek The Real (الحق) neither from within nor from without, since entering and exiting are attributes of origination (*ḥudūth*). Look at the All within the All, and you will find the All. The Throne (*al-‘Arsh*) is the Gathering (مجموع), and the Footstool (*al-Kursī*) is the Differentiation (مفروق).

> O seeker of the existence of The Real, that he may grasp it,
> Return to your Essence (ذاتك); The Real is within you, so adhere to it.

<<Go back behind you and seek light (ارْجِعُوا وَراءَكُمْ فَالْتَمِسُوا نُوراً)>>. Had they not turned back, they would have found the Light. But when they turned back with the conviction of separation, a wall (السور) was erected between them. Otherwise, had they known who called out to them with the words, "Go back behind you," they would have said, "You are our goal," and they would not have turned back. Thus, their turning back was the cause of the wall being erected between them. Hell appeared, and <<they will be thrown into it headlong, they and the deviators (فَكُبْكِبُوا فِيها هُمْ والْغاوُونَ)>>. The Unitarians (*al-Muwaḥḥidūn*) remained, sustaining the people of Paradise with youths and beautiful maidens from the Presence of Witnessing (حضرة العيان). The Vizier is the locus of the Prince’s Attributes (صفات الأمير), and the Attribute with which the Prince alone is singularized is the secret of governance (*sirr al-tadbīr*) from which the Attributes emerged. Thus, he knows what issues from his Attribute and Act in totality, while the Vizier knows it only in detail. This is the difference. Reflect upon what we have said, and you will find The Real, God willing. If this is made clear and established—that the *Alif* is the Essence (ذات) of the Word (الكلمة), the *Lām* is the essence of the Attribute (عين الصفة), and the *Mīm* is the essence of the Act (عين الفعل)—then their hidden secret is the One who brings them into existence.

Section [Continuation of the Discourse on *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) and *That is the Book* (ذلِكَ الْكِتابُ) from the Path of Secrets]

We say that His saying, <<That is the Book (ذلِكَ الْكِتابُ)>>, after His saying *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم), is an indication of an existent thing, yet it contains distance. The reason for the distance is that He pointed to the Book, which is the Differentiated (المفروق), the locus of detail, and He introduced the letter *Lām* into *dhālika* (that), which signifies distance in this station. The indication is a call at the peak of distance according to the People of Allah. And because the *Lām*—I mean—is from the Middle World (العالم الوسط), it is the locus of the Attribute (الصفة), since it is by the Attribute that the originated (*al-muḥdath*) is distinguished from the Eternal (القديم). He specified the address of the singular with a singular *Kāf* (in *dhālika*) so that there would be no confusion among the originated things (*al-mubda‘āt*). We have fully discussed this section when we spoke about His saying, the Exalted, <<Remove your sandals (فَاخْلَعْ نَعْلَيْكَ)>>, in the Book of Gathering and Differentiation (*Kitāb al-Jam‘ wa al-Tafṣīl*), meaning: remove the *Lām* and the *Mīm*, and the *Alif*, transcendent of Attributes (المنزهة عن الصفات), remains.

Then He intervened between the *Dhāl* (in *dhālika*), which is the Book, the locus of the second Differentiation, and the *Lām*, which is the Attribute, the locus of the first Differentiation by which the Book is read, using the *Alif*, which is the locus of Gathering (محل الجمع). This is so that the address of Differentiation is not mistakenly taken from another differentiation, thereby never reaching the Reality. Thus, He separated them with the *Alif*, which became a veil (حجاب) between the *Dhāl* and the *Lām*. The *Dhāl* desired to reach the *Lām*, so the *Alif* stood up for it and said, "Through me you shall reach." The *Lām* desired to meet the *Dhāl* to deliver its trust to it, and the *Alif* also presented itself to the *Lām* and said, "Through me you shall meet it." Whenever you observe Existence (الوجود) in Gathering and Differentiation, you will find Unity (التوحيد) accompanying it, never separating from it, just as the One accompanies the numbers. For the Two never exists unless you add its like to the One, which is the Two. And the Three is not correct unless you add one to the Two, and so on, infinitely. The One is not the number, yet it is the essence of the number; that is, through it the number appeared. All number is One. If one were subtracted from the thousand, the name and reality of the thousand would cease to exist, and another reality would remain, which is nine hundred and ninety-nine. If one were subtracted from that, its essence would vanish. Whenever the One ceases to exist in a thing, that thing ceases to exist; and whenever it is affirmed, that thing exists. This is Unity (التوحيد), if you verify it: <<And He is with you wherever you are>>.

So He said *dhā* (ذا), which is an ambiguous letter. He clarified that ambiguity by His saying *al-Kitāb* (الكتاب), which is the reality of *dhā*. He led the Book with the *alif* and *lām* of definition and covenant, which are the *Alif* and *Lām* of *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم), except that here they are not in the aspect they held in *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم). For there, they were in the locus of Gathering (محل الجمع), while here they are in the first chapter of the chapters of Differentiation (التفصيل), but specifically the differentiation of the secrets of this Sura, not in other Suras. This is the arrangement of the Realities (الحقائق) in Existence (الوجود). Thus, <<That is the Book (ذلِكَ الْكِتابُ)>> is the Inscribed Book (*al-Kitāb al-Marqūm*), because the Mothers of the Books are three: the Written Book (*al-Kitāb al-Masṭūr*), the Inscribed Book (*al-Kitāb al-Marqūm*), and the Unknown Book (*al-Kitāb al-Majhūl*). We have explained the meaning of the Book and the Writer in the Book of Divine Governance in the Rectification of the Human Kingdom (*Kitāb al-Tadbīrāt al-Ilāhiyya fī Iṣlāḥ al-Mamlaka al-Insāniyya*), in the ninth chapter thereof, so refer to it there.

We say that even if the essences (الذوات) are unified in meaning, there must be a meaning by which the two essences are differentiated, and this is called the description (*al-waṣf*). The Inscribed Book is described by inscription, and the Written Book is described by writing. This Unknown Book, from which the description is stripped, must be one of two things: either it is an Attribute (صفة), and therefore is not described, or it is an Essence (ذات) that is not described. Unveiling (الكشف) grants that it is an Attribute called Knowledge (*al-‘Ilm*), and the hearts of the words of The Real are its locus. Do you not see Him saying, *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم), <<The revelation of the Book (تَنْزِيلُ الْكِتابِ)>>? Say: <<He sent it down with His Knowledge (أَنْزَلَهُ بِعِلْمِهِ)>>. Thus, He addressed the *Kāf* of *dhālika* (that) with the Attribute of Knowledge, which is the *Lām* lowered by descent, because He is transcendent of His Essence being comprehended. So He said to the *Kāf*, which is the Divine Word (الكلمة الإلهية): "That Book revealed upon you is My Knowledge, not your knowledge. There is no doubt in it (لا ريب فيه) according to the People of Realities (أهل الحقائق). I revealed it in the context of guidance for those who fear Me, and you are the recipient of the revelation, so you are its locus."

Every book must have a Mother (*Umm*), and the Mother of that Unknown Book is something you will never know, because it is neither an Attribute for you nor for anyone else, nor is it an Essence. If you wish to verify this, look at how knowledge is attained in the cosmos, or how the image of the seen object is attained in the seer. It is not, and there is nothing else. Look at the degrees and stations of the letters of <<There is no doubt in it, a guidance for the righteous (لا ريب فيه هدى للمتقين)>> according to what we shall mention after the discourse we are currently engaged in. Reflect upon what I have disseminated to you, and untie the knot of the *Lām-Alif* (لا) of *lā rayba* (no doubt); it becomes two *Alifs* (ا ا), because the curve of the *Lām* appeared in the form of the *Nūn* of *al-muttaqīn* (the righteous). This is due to the *Alif* being delayed from the *Lām* of its other name, which is the Gnosis (المعرفة) that the servant attains from himself, as in the Prophet’s saying, peace be upon him: <<Whoever knows himself knows his Lord>>. Thus, the knowledge of the *Lām* precedes the knowledge of the *Alif*, and it became a proof (*dalīl*) of it. They did not mix to become a single Essence (ذات واحدة); rather, each was distinct in its own essence. For this reason, the proof and the proven thing do not unite, but the face of the proof is the link, which is the point of connection between the *Lām* and the *Alif*. Multiply the two *Alifs* (ا ا), one by the other, and you will obtain a single *Alif* (آ) externally. This is the reality of connection (*ittiṣāl*). Likewise, multiply the originated (*al-muḥdath*) by the Eternal (القديم) perceptually: the originated thing appears externally, and the Eternal is concealed by its emergence. This is the reality of connection and unification (*ittiḥād*). <<And [mention] when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I will place upon the earth a successor (خَلِيفَةً)>>. This contradicts the indication of al-Junayd in his saying to the sneezer that when the originated thing is compared to the Eternal, no trace of it remains, due to the difference in station.

Do you not see how the *Lām-Alif* (لا) of *lā rayba fīhi* (no doubt in it) connected from the Footstool (*al-Kursī*), so two essences (ذاتان) appeared (لآ)? The secret of the knot between them is unknown. Then the Throne (*al-‘Arsh*) separated them upon returning to it and reaching it, so it became in this form (آل). The *Lām* appeared with its reality because the station of connection and unification was not established by one who would return it to its form. So we brought forth the half-circle of the *Lām* that was concealed in the *Lām-Alif* (لا) into the world of composition (عالم التركيب) and sense. Two *Alifs* (أ أ) remained in the Differentiation. We multiplied the One by the One—which is multiplying a thing by itself—and it became One (آ). The One clothed the other. The One that appeared was the cloak (*ridā’*), and it is the originated successor (*al-khalīfa al-mubda‘*). The other was the wearer of the cloak (*al-murtadī*), and it is the one that was concealed, the Eternal Originator (*al-Qadīm al-Mubdi‘*). The wearer of the cloak is only known by the inner side of the cloak, which is the Gathering (الجمع), and the cloak takes the shape of the wearer. If you say "One," you speak truly. And if you say "Two Essences (ذاتان)," you speak truly, both perceptually and through Unveiling (كشفا). How excellent is the saying of the one who said:

> The glass was subtle, and the wine was subtle,
> So they resembled each other, and the matter became confused.
> It is as if there is wine but no cup,
> And as if there is a cup but no wine.

As for the outer side of the cloak, it never knows the wearer; rather, it knows the inner side of its own essence, which is its veil (حجاب). Likewise, The Real (الحق) is only known by Knowledge (العلم), just as He is only truly praised by Praise (*al-Ḥamd*). As for you, you know Him through the mediation of Knowledge, and that is your veil. For you only witness the Knowledge that subsists in you, even if it corresponds to the Known Thing (*al-Ma‘lūm*). Your knowledge subsists in you, and it is what you witness and what you worship. Beware, if you follow the method of the Realities (الحقائق), of saying that you have known the Known Thing; rather, you have known Knowledge, and Knowledge is the knower of the Known Thing. Between Knowledge and the Known Thing are seas whose depths cannot be fathomed, for the secret of the relation between them, despite the disparity of their realities, is a difficult sea to navigate. Indeed, neither expression nor indication can navigate it at all. Rather, it is grasped by Unveiling (الكشف) from behind many subtle veils, so fine that one does not perceive them to be upon the eye of his insight, and yet they are difficult to grasp—how much more difficult is the One who created them! Look, then, where is the one who says, "I knew the thing from that thing," whether it was originated or Eternal? This applies even to the originated thing, but concerning the Eternal, it is much, much further, since He has no likeness. From where, then, can knowledge of Him be attained, or how can it be acquired? The discussion of this sublime issue will come in the third section of this chapter.

The outer side of the cloak only knows the wearer from the perspective of Existence (الوجود), provided that it is in the Station of Seeking Rain (*Istisqā’*). Then it vanishes and returns, because this is a knowledge of causality, not a knowledge of attraction (*jadhb*). This is the vision of the people of Paradise in the Hereafter, which is a Theophany (تجلي) at one time but not another. The discussion of this will come in the chapter on Paradise in this book. This is the Station of Differentiation (*al-Tafriqa*). As for the People of Realities (أهل الحقائق), the inner side of the cloak, they remain perpetually witnessing (مشاهدين). And despite their witnessing, their outer aspect, in the Footstool of Attributes (كرسي الصفات), enjoys the materials of the inner skin—the bliss of connection (*ittiṣāl*).

Look at His wisdom in that being a subject (*mubtada’*) and not an agent (*fā‘il*) or an object whose agent is unnamed (*maf‘ūl lam yusamma fā‘iluhu*). It is not correct for it to be an agent because of His saying, <<There is no doubt in it (لا ريب فيه)>>. If it were an agent, doubt would occur, because the agent is only *huwa* (He). How, then, can something that is not His Attribute be ascribed to Him? The station of the *Dhāl* also prevents this, for it is one of the Realities that existed when nothing was with it. For this reason, it does not connect to letters when it precedes them, like the *Alif* and its sisters: the *Dāl*, *Rā’*, *Zāy*, and *Wāw*. Nor can it be called an object whose agent is unnamed, because it necessarily requires a preceding word with a specific structure, the locus of which is grammar (*naḥw*). The Book here is the Act (*al-Fi‘l*) itself, and the Act is not described as an agent or an object. Since it is in the nominative case (*marfū‘*), it remains only that it is a subject (*mubtada’*). The meaning of a subject is that nothing else was known from the very first moment: <<Am I not your Lord? (أَ لَسْتُ بِرَبِّكُمْ)>> They said, <<Yes (بَلى)>>. If it is said, "It is necessary for every subject to have an initial factor (*ibtidā’*) acting upon it," we say: Yes, the Mother of the Book (*Umm al-Kitāb*) acted upon it. It is the initial factor acting upon the Book, and the ultimate Agent in all things, The Real and creation, is Allah, the Lord. For this reason, Allah, blessed and exalted, warned by His saying: <<Be grateful to Me and to your parents (أَنِ اشْكُرْ لِي ولِوالِدَيْكَ)>>. Thus, He associated. Then He said: <<To Me is the destination (إِلَيَّ الْمَصِيرُ)>>. Thus, He unified. Gratitude is from the Station of Differentiation (*al-Tafriqa*). Likewise, you should be grateful to the cloak (*ridā’*) since it was a means of connection to the wearer (*al-murtadī*). The destination, from the cloak and from you, is to the wearer, and everyone reaches according to his nature. So understand what we have said, and distinguish between the station of the *Dhāl* and the *Alif*, even though they share the sacred Station of Unity (مقام الوحدانية), being prior in state and station, and posterior in station but not in state.

Note [Continuation of the Discourse on *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) and *That is the Book* (ذلِكَ الْكِتابُ) from the Path of Secrets]

He said <<That (ذلِكَ)>> and did not say <<Those are the verses (تِلْكَ آياتُ الْكِتابِ)>>. The Book is for Gathering (الجمع), and the verses (*al-āyāt*) are for Differentiation (التفرقة). *Dhālika* is masculine singular, and *tilka* is feminine singular. Thus, the Exalted first pointed with *dhālika al-kitāb* to the existence of Gathering as the origin before Differentiation. Then He originated Differentiation in the verses, just as He gathered all number in the One, as we previously established. If we remove the One, the reality of that number ceases to exist, and no trace of the *Alif* remains in Existence. If we manifest the One, the *Alif* manifests in Existence. Look at this marvelous power granted by the reality of the One, from which this infinite Multiplicity (الكثرة) appeared, while He is singular in Himself, in Essence (ذاتا) and Name (اسما).

Then He originated Differentiation in the verses. The Exalted said: <<Indeed, We sent it down during a blessed night (إِنَّا أَنْزَلْناهُ في لَيْلَةٍ مُبارَكَةٍ)>>. Then He said: <<In it is made distinct every precise matter (فِيها يُفْرَقُ كُلُّ أَمْرٍ حَكِيمٍ)>>. He began with Gathering, which is "every thing." The Exalted said: <<And We wrote for him on the tablets [an instruction] of every thing (وكَتَبْنا لَهُ في الْأَلْواحِ من كُلِّ شَيْ‏ءٍ)>>. "On the tablets" is the station of Differentiation. "Of every thing" is an indication of Gathering. "An admonition and a detail" refers back to Differentiation. "For every thing" refers back to Gathering. Every existent thing, generally speaking, must be either in the essence of Gathering (عين الجمع) or in the essence of Differentiation (عين الفرق), and nothing else. There is no way for an existent thing to be devoid of these two realities, nor can it ever combine them. The Real (الحق) and the Human (الإنسان) are in the essence of Gathering, and the Cosmos (العالم) is in the essence of Differentiation. They do not gather, just as The Real never separates, just as the Human never separates.

Allah, glory be to Him, has always been in His eternity (أزله) with His Essence (ذاته), Attributes (صفاته), and Names (أسمائه). No state has been renewed upon Him, nor has any description been affirmed for Him by the creation of the cosmos that He did not possess before that. Rather, He is now as He was before the existence of creation, just as the Prophet, peace be upon him, described Him when he said: "Allah was, and there was nothing with Him." And the addition in the saying, "And He is now as He was," their intention is that the Attribute that was necessary for Him before the existence of the cosmos, He possesses it while the cosmos exists. This is how the Realities (الحقائق) stand for whoever wishes to grasp them. Masculinization (*al-tadhkīr*) is in the origin, which is Adam—His saying *dhālika* (that). Feminization (*al-ta’nīth*) is in the branch, which is Eve (Ḥawwā’)—His saying *tilka* (those). We have fully discussed this section in the Book of Gathering and Differentiation (*Kitāb al-Jam‘ wa al-Tafṣīl*) which we composed concerning the knowledge of the secrets of Revelation. Adam is for all the Attributes (الصفات), and Eve is for the differentiation of the Essences (تفريق الذوات), since she is the locus of the Act (الفعل) and the seed. Likewise, the verses (*al-āyāt*) are the locus of rulings and judgments. Allah, the Exalted, combined the meaning of *dhālika* and *tilka* in His saying: <<And We gave him wisdom and decisive speech (وآتَيْناهُ الْحِكْمَةَ وفَصْلَ الْخِطابِ)>>.

The letters of *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) are three in writing, and this is the totality of their world. For they contain the *Hamza*, which is from the Higher World (العالم الأعلى), the *Lām*, which is from the Middle World (العالم الوسط), and the *Mīm*, which is from the Lower World (العالم الأسفل). Thus, *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) has gathered the Isthmus (البرزخ), the two Abodes, the Link, and the two Realities. It is half of the letters of its pronunciation without repetition, and it is on the three without repetition, and each one of them is a third of every three. All these are secrets that we have traced in the Book of Beginnings and Ends (*Kitāb al-Mabādī wa al-Ghāyāt*) and in the Book of Gathering and Differentiation (*Kitāb al-Jam‘ wa al-Tafṣīl*). Let this amount of discourse on *Alif-Lām-Mīm* (الم) of Sūrat al-Baqara suffice in this chapter, after we desired to refrain from recording what was unveiled to us concerning the Book and the Writer. Indeed, tremendous and terrifying matters were unveiled to us therein, causing us to throw the notebook from our hands upon their manifestation and flee to the cosmos until that feeling subsided. Only then did we return to recording on the second day of that Theophany (التجلي). The desire for it was accepted, and it was held back from us. We now return to discussing the letters one by one, as we stipulated at the beginning of this chapter, desiring brevity and conciseness. <<And Allah speaks the truth, and He guides to the way>>. The Fifth Part is concluded. <<Praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds>>.

[Discourse on the Letters, Letter by Letter]

[From that is the Letter *Alif*]

> The *Alif* of the Essence (الذات) is transcendent, so does
> It have an eye or a locus in the created worlds?
> It said: No, save for my turning; for I am
> The letter of everlastingness, encompassing eternity (الأزل).
> I am the weak, chosen servant,
> And I am the one whose dominion is mighty and majestic.

The *Alif* is not considered one of the letters by those who have smelled the fragrance of the Realities (الحقائق), but the common people have named it a letter. When the Verifier (*al-Muḥaqqiq*) says it is a letter, he says so only by way of metaphorical expression. The Station of the *Alif* is the Station of Gathering (مقام الجمع). Among the Names (الأسماء), it has the Name Allah. Among the Attributes (الصفات), it has the Self-Subsisting (*al-Qayyūmiyya*). Among the Names of Acts (أسماء الأفعال), it has the Originator (*al-Mubdi’*), the Resurrector (*al-Bā‘ith*), the All-Encompassing (*al-Wāsi‘*), the Preserver (*al-Ḥāfiẓ*), the Creator (*al-Khāliq*), the Maker (*al-Bāri’*), the Fashioner (*al-Muṣawwir*), the Bestower (*al-Wahhāb*), the Provider (*al-Razzāq*), the Opener (*al-Fattāḥ*), the Expander (*al-Bāsiṭ*), the Honorer (*al-Mu‘izz*), the Restorer (*al-Mu‘īd*), the Exalter (*al-Rāfi‘*), the Giver of Life (*al-Muḥyī*), the Governor (*al-Wālī*), the Gatherer (*al-Jāmi‘*), the Enricher (*al-Mughnī*), and the Benefactor (*al-Nāfi‘*). Among the Names of the Essence (أسماء الذات), it has Allah, the Lord (*al-Rabb*), the Manifest (*al-Ẓāhir*), the One (*al-Wāḥid*), the First (*al-Awwal*), the Last (*al-Ākhir*), the Eternal Refuge (*al-Ṣamad*), the Rich (*al-Ghanī*), the Watcher (*al-Raqīb*), the Firm (*al-Matīn*), and The Real (*al-Ḥaqq*). Among the pronounced letters (*al-ḥurūf al-lafẓiyya*), it has the *Hamza*, the *Lām*, and the *Fā’*. Among the simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Zāy*, the *Mīm*, the *Hā’*, the *Fā’*, the *Lām*, and the *Hamza*. It has all the Levels (المراتب), and its manifestation is in the sixth level. The apparent locus of its dominion is in the plant kingdom. Its sisters in this level are the *Hā’* and the *Lām*. It encompasses the totality of the world of letters and their levels, being neither within nor outside of them: the dot of the circle and its circumference, and the composite and simple aspects of the worlds.

[And from that is the Letter *Hamza*]

> A *Hamza* cuts time and connects
> Everything separated that neighbors it.
> It is Time (*al-Dahr*), mighty is its measure,
> Too majestic for a similitude to be presented for it.

The *Hamza* is one of the letters from the World of Witnessing (عالم الشهادة) and the Divine Kingdom (الملكوت). Its point of articulation is the deepest part of the throat. It has no level in number. Among the simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Fā’*, the *Mīm*, the *Zāy*, the *Alif*, and the *Yā’*. It belongs to the World of the Divine Kingdom (الملكوت). It has the Fourth Sphere, and the cycle of its sphere is nine thousand years. Among the Levels (المراتب), it has the fourth, sixth, and seventh. The manifestation of its dominion is in the Jinn, the plant kingdom, and the mineral kingdom. Among the letters, it has the *Hā’*, the *Mīm*, the *Zāy*, the *Hā’* in pause, the *Tā’* with both pronunciations from above in connection, and the *tanwīn* (nunation) in separation. Among the Names (الأسماء), it has what the *Alif*, *Wāw*, and *Yā’* have, making repetition unnecessary. Among the Names of Attributes (أسماء الصفات), it is specific to the Subduer (*al-Qahhār*), the Dominant (*al-Qāhir*), the Omnipotent (*al-Muqtadir*), the Strong (*al-Qawī*), and the Powerful (*al-Qādir*). Its nature (*ṭab‘*) is heat and dryness, and its element is Fire. Scholars have differed on whether it is a letter or half a letter in the numerical letters, but regarding its articulation, there is no disagreement that it is a letter according to everyone.

[And from that is the Letter *Hā’*]

> The *Hā’* of Identity (*al-Huwiyya*), how much it points to every possessor
> Of I-ness (*Inniyya*) that is concealed from him in the manifest.
> Why did you not annihilate the existence of your trace when
> The eyes of the Last appear to the First of it?

Know that the *Hā’* is one of the letters of the Unseen (*al-Ghayb*). Its point of articulation is the deepest part of the throat. Its numerical value is five. Among the simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Alif*, the *Hamza*, the *Lām*, the *Hā’*, the *Mīm*, and the *Zāy*. It belongs to the World of the Divine Kingdom (الملكوت). It has the Fourth Sphere, and the time of its sphere’s movement is nine thousand years. Among the classes, it has the elite (*al-khāṣṣa*) and the elite of the elite (*khāṣṣat al-khāṣṣa*). Among the Levels (المراتب), it has the sixth. The manifestation of its dominion is in the plant kingdom. At its end, there is found what was hot and moist, and after that, it transforms it into coldness and dryness. It has straight and crooked movements. It is one of the letters of the veins (*al-a‘rāq*). It possesses mixture (*al-imzizāj*). It is one of the perfect letters (*al-kawāmil*). It belongs to the World of Singularity (عالم الانفراد). Its nature is coldness and dryness, and heat and moisture, like Mercury (*‘Uṭārid*). Its greatest element is Earth, and its lesser element is Air. Among the letters, it has the *Alif* and the *Hamza*. Among the Names of the Essence (الأسماء الذاتية), it has Allah, the First (*al-Awwal*), the Last (*al-Ākhir*), the Glorious (*al-Mājid*), the Giver of Security (*al-Mu’min*), the Guardian (*al-Muhaymin*), the Supreme (*al-Mutakabbir*), the Firm (*al-Matīn*), the One (*al-Aḥad*), and the King (*al-Malik*). Among the Names of Attributes (أسماء الصفات), it has the Omnipotent (*al-Muqtadir*) and the Reckoner (*al-Muḥṣī*). Among the Names of Acts (أسماء الأفعال), it has the Subtle (*al-Laṭīf*), the Opener (*al-Fattāḥ*), the Originator (*al-Mubdi’*), the Responder (*al-Mujīb*), the Maintainer (*al-Muqīt*), the Fashioner (*al-Muṣawwir*), the Humiliator (*al-Mudhill*), the Honorer (*al-Mu‘izz*), the Restorer (*al-Mu‘īd*), the Giver of Life (*al-Muḥyī*), the Giver of Death (*al-Mumīt*), the Avenger (*al-Muntaqim*), the Equitable (*al-Muqsiṭ*), the Enricher (*al-Mughnī*), and the Withholder (*al-Māni‘*). It represents the goal of the Path.

[And from that is the Letter *‘Ayn* (Undotted)]

> The *‘Ayn* of the springs is the Reality of Origination (حقيقة الإيجاد),
> So look at it in the station of witnessing (منزل الاشهاد).
> You will see it looking toward the Originator of its Essence,
> The gaze of the sick person upon the beauty of the visitors.
> It never turns to other than its God,
> Hoping and fearing, the characteristic of servants.

Know that the *‘Ayn* is from the World of Witnessing (عالم الشهادة) and the Divine Kingdom (الملكوت). Its point of articulation is the middle of the throat. Its numerical value in the *Jumal* calculation is the knot of seventy. Among the simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Yā’*, the *Nūn*, the *Alif*, the *Hamza*, and the *Wāw*. It has the Second Sphere, and the time of its sphere’s movement is eleven thousand years. Among the classes of the cosmos, it has the elite and the elite of the elite. Among the Levels (المراتب), it has the fifth. The manifestation of its dominion is in the animal kingdom. Everything hot and moist is found through it. It has horizontal movements, which are crooked. It is one of the letters of the Heights (*al-A‘rāf*). It is one of the pure letters. It is perfect. It belongs to the dual world of humanity. Its nature is heat and moisture. Among the letters, it has the *Yā’* and the *Nūn*. Among the Names of the Essence (الأسماء الذاتية), it has the Rich (*al-Ghanī*), the First (*al-Awwal*), and the Last (*al-Ākhir*). Among the Names of Attributes (أسماء الصفات), it has the Strong (*al-Qawī*), the Reckoner (*al-Muḥṣī*), and the Living (*al-Ḥayy*). Among the Names of Acts (أسماء الأفعال), it has the Helper (*al-Naṣīr*), the Benefactor (*al-Nāfi‘*), the All-Encompassing (*al-Wāsi‘*), the Bestower (*al-Wahhāb*), and the Governor (*al-Wālī*).

[And from that is the Letter *Ḥā’* (Undotted)]

> The *Ḥā’* of the *Ḥawāmīm* is the secret of Allah in the Suras,
> Whose reality He concealed from the sight of humankind.
> If you depart from existence and from phantom,
> Then journey to the world of spirits and forms.
> And look at the bearers of the Throne, who have looked
> At their realities, which came according to measure.
> You will find for your *Ḥā’* a dominion and a might
> That it neither approaches nor fears from others.

Know, O saint (*walī*), that the *Ḥā’* is from the World of the Unseen (*al-Ghayb*). Its point of articulation is the middle of the throat. Its numerical value is eight. Among the simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Alif*, the *Hamza*, the *Lām*, the *Hā’*, the *Fā’*, the *Mīm*, and the *Zāy*. It belongs to the World of the Divine Kingdom (الملكوت). It has the Second Sphere, and the years of its sphere’s movement are eleven thousand years. It belongs to the elite and the elite of the elite. Among the Levels (المراتب), it has the seventh. The manifestation of its dominion is in the mineral kingdom. Everything cold and moist is found through it, and its element is Water. It has crooked movements. It is one of the letters of the veins (*al-a‘rāq*). It is pure, unmixed. It is perfect. It elevates whoever connects to it. It belongs to the triple world of humanity. Its nature is coldness and moisture. Among the letters, it has the *Alif* and the *Hamza*. Among the Names of the Essence (أسماء الذات), it has Allah, the First (*al-Awwal*), the Last (*al-Ākhir*), the King (*al-Malik*), the Giver of Security (*al-Mu’min*), the Guardian (*al-Muhaymin*), the Supreme (*al-Mutakabbir*), the Glorious (*al-Majīd*), the Firm (*al-Matīn*), the Most High (*al-Muta‘ālī*), and the Mighty (*al-‘Azīz*). Among the Names of Attributes (أسماء الصفات), it has the Omnipotent (*al-Muqtadir*) and the Reckoner (*al-Muḥṣī*). Among the Names of Acts (أسماء الأفعال), it has the Subtle (*al-Laṭīf*), the Opener (*al-Fattāḥ*), the Originator (*al-Mubdi’*), the Responder (*al-Mujīb*), the Maintainer (*al-Muqīt*), the Fashioner (*al-Muṣawwir*), the Humiliator (*al-Mudhill*), the Honorer (*al-Mu‘izz*), the Restorer (*al-Mu‘īd*), the Giver of Life (*al-Muḥyī*), the Giver of Death (*al-Mumīt*), the Avenger (*al-Muntaqim*), the Equitable (*al-Muqsiṭ*), the Enricher (*al-Mughnī*), and the Withholder (*al-Māni‘*). It represents the beginning of the Path.

[And from that is the Letter *Ghāyn* (Dotted)]

> The *Ghāyn* is like the *‘Ayn* in its states,
> Except for its most tremendous and dangerous Theophany (تجلي).
> In the *Ghāyn* are the secrets of the Overpowering Theophany (التجلي الأقهر),
> So know the reality of its effusion and conceal yourself.
> And look at it from the curtain of its existence,
> Cautious for the weak and insignificant trace.

Know, may Allah support you with a spirit from Him, that the dotted *Ghāyn* is from the World of Witnessing (عالم الشهادة) and the Divine Kingdom (الملكوت). Its point of articulation is the throat, the nearest part of it to the mouth. Its numerical value according to the People of Secrets (أهل الأسرار) is nine hundred, and according to the People of Lights (أهل الأنوار), its value is one thousand—all in the major *Jumal* calculation. Among its simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Yā’*, the *Nūn*, the *Alif*, the *Hamza*, and the *Wāw*.
