It has the Second Sphere, and the years of its sphere’s movement are eleven thousand years. It is distinguished in the class of the common people. Its level (مرتبته) is the fifth. The manifestation of its dominion is in the animal kingdom. Its nature is coldness and moisture. Its element is Water. Everything cold and moist is found through it. Its movement is crooked. It possesses character (*al-khuluq*), states (*al-aḥwāl*), and miraculous gifts (*al-karāmāt*). It is pure, perfect, dual, and companionable. It possesses essential singularity (الإفراد الذاتي). Among the letters, it has the *Yā’* and the *Nūn*. Among the Names of the Essence (الأسماء الذاتية), it has the Rich (*al-Ghanī*), the High (*al-‘Alī*), Allah, the First (*al-Awwal*), the Last (*al-Ākhir*), and the One (*al-Wāḥid*). Among the Names of Attributes (أسماء الصفات), it has the Living (*al-Ḥayy*), the Reckoner (*al-Muḥṣī*), and the Strong (*al-Qawī*). Among the Names of Acts (أسماء الأفعال), it has the Helper (*al-Naṣīr*), the Protector (*al-Wāqī*), the All-Encompassing (*al-Wāsi‘*), the Governor (*al-Wālī*), and the Trustee (*al-Wakīl*). It is of the Divine Kingdom (ملكوتي).

[And from that is the Letter *Khā’* (Dotted)]

> The *Khā’*, whether it approaches or retreats,
> Gives you of its secrets and then withdraws.
> Its height desires the entity (*al-kiyān*), and its depth
> Desires the Originator (*al-Mukawwin*)—a wisdom that has been manifested.
> The designer of its Essence revealed its reality,
> So it was defiled for a time, and then purified.
> Marvel at it: a Paradise brought near
> In its depth, and the blaze of a fire kindled.

Know, may Allah support you, that the *Khā’* is from the World of the Unseen (عالم الغيب) and the Divine Kingdom (الملكوت). Its point of articulation is the throat, near the mouth. Its numerical value is six hundred. Among its simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Alif*, the *Hamza*, the *Lām*, the *Fā’*, the *Hā’*, the *Mīm*, and the *Zāy*. It has the Second Sphere, and the years of its sphere’s movement are eleven thousand years. It is distinguished in the common class. Its level (مرتبته) is the seventh. The manifestation of its dominion is in the mineral kingdom. The nature of its head is coldness and dryness, and heat and moisture. The rest of its body’s greatest element is Air, and the lesser is Earth. Everything in which the four natures are combined is found through it. Its movement is crooked. It possesses states (*al-aḥwāl*), character (*al-khuluq*), and miraculous gifts (*al-karāmāt*). It is mixed, perfect. It elevates whoever connects to it, by itself. It is triangular and companionable. It has a sign. Among the letters, it has the *Hamza* and the *Alif*. Among the Names of the Essence, Attributes, and Acts, it has every Name that begins with a *Zāy* or a *Mīm*, such as the King (*al-Malik*), the Omnipotent (*al-Muqtadir*), and the Honorer (*al-Mu‘izz*); or a *Hā’*, such as the Guide (*al-Hādī*); or a *Fā’*, such as the Opener (*al-Fattāḥ*); or a *Lām*, such as the Subtle (*al-Laṭīf*); or a *Hamza*, such as the First (*al-Awwal*).

[And from that is the Letter *Qāf*]

> The *Qāf*—the secret of its perfection is in its head,
> And the sciences of the People of the Arabs are the beginning of its drop.
> And longing bends it, making its Unseen (*ghayb*)
> In one half, and its Witnessing (*shuhūd*) in the other half.
> Look at its curve like its crescent,
> And look at the shape of the chief like its full moon.
> Marvel at the last of creation, which is the beginning
> For the existence of its originator and the beginning of its age.

Know, may Allah support us and you, that the *Qāf* is from the World of Witnessing (عالم الشهادة) and the Divine Compulsion (الجبروت). Its point of articulation is the deepest part of the tongue and the palate above it. Its numerical value is one hundred. Among its simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Alif*, the *Fā’*, the *Hamza*, and the *Lām*. It has the Second Sphere, and the years of its sphere’s movement are eleven thousand years. It is distinguished in the elite and the elite of the elite. Its level (مرتبته) is the fourth. The manifestation of its dominion is in the Jinn. Its nature is the first Mothers: its end is hot and dry, and the rest of it is cold and moist. Its elements are Water and Fire. The human being (الإنسان) and the ‘Anqā’ (Phoenix) are found through it. It possesses states (*al-aḥwāl*). Its movement is mixed. It is mixed, companionable, and dual. Its sign is shared. Among the letters, it has the *Alif* and the *Fā’*. Among the Names (الأسماء) according to their levels, it has every Name whose first letter is one of its simple letters. It possesses the Essence (الذات) according to the People of Secrets (أهل الأسرار), and the Essence and the Attributes (الصفات) according to the People of Lights (أهل الأنوار).

[And from that is the Letter *Kāf*]

> The *Kāf* of hope witnesses Majesty (الإجلال),
> While the *Kāf* of fear witnesses Grace (الإفضال).
> Look at contraction (*qabḍ*) and expansion (*basṭ*) in them,
> One gives you aversion, and the other, connection.
> Allah has manifested His Majesty to the former,
> And to the latter, He manifested Beauty from His radiance.

Know, may Allah support us and you, that the *Kāf* is from the World of the Unseen (عالم الغيب) and the Divine Compulsion (الجبروت). Its point of articulation is the same as the *Qāf*, as mentioned, except that it is lower than it. Its numerical value is twenty. Among its simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Alif*, the *Fā’*, the *Hamza*, and the *Lām*. It has the Second Sphere, and the movement of its sphere is eleven thousand years. It is distinguished in the elite and the elite of the elite. Its level (مرتبته) is the fourth. The manifestation of its dominion is in the Jinn. Everything hot and dry is found through it. Its element is Fire. Its nature is heat and dryness. Its station is the beginning. Its movement is mixed. It is one of the letters of the veins (*al-a‘rāq*). It is pure, perfect. It elevates whoever connects to it according to the People of Lights (أهل الأنوار), but it does not elevate according to the People of Secrets (أهل الأسرار). It is singular and solitary. Among the letters, it has what the *Qāf* has. Among the Names (الأسماء), it has every Name whose first letter is one of its simple letters and its own letters.

[And from that is the Letter *Ḍād* (Dotted)]

> In the *Ḍād* is a secret; if I were to reveal its mention,
> You would see the secret of Allah in His Divine Compulsion (جبروته).
> Look at it as One, and its perfection
> Is from other than itself in the two Presences of His Mercy.
> And its Imam is the pronunciation by whose existence
> The All-Merciful made him journey from His Divine Kingdom (ملكوته).

Know, may Allah support us and you, that the dotted *Ḍād* is one of the letters of Witnessing (الشهادة) and Divine Compulsion (الجبروت). Its point of articulation is the beginning edge of the tongue and the molars adjacent to it. Its numerical value is ninety according to us, and eight hundred according to the People of Lights (أهل الأنوار). Among its simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Alif*, the dry *Dāl*, the *Hamza*, the *Lām*, and the *Fā’*. It has the Second Sphere, and the movement of its sphere is eleven thousand years. It is distinguished in the common class. It has the middle of the Path. Its level (مرتبته) is the fifth. The manifestation of its dominion is in the animal kingdom. Its nature is coldness and moisture. Its element is Water. Everything cold and moist is found through it. Its movement is mixed. It possesses character (*al-khuluq*), states (*al-aḥwāl*), and miraculous gifts (*al-karāmāt*). It is pure, perfect, dual, and companionable. Its sign is singularity (*al-fardāniyya*). Among the letters, it has the *Alif* and the *Dāl*. Among the Names (الأسماء), it has what we informed you of in the preceding letter, desiring brevity. And Allah is the Helper, the Guide.

[And from that is the Letter *Jīm*]

> The *Jīm* elevates whoever desires connection to Him,
> To the witnessing places of the righteous and the chosen.
> It is the perpetual servant, yet it is
> Verified by the Reality of Altruism (*al-Īthār*).
> With its goal, it gazes toward its Worshipped One,
> And with its beginning, it walks upon the traces.
> It is from three known realities,
> And its temperament is coldness and the scorching of fire.

Know, may Allah support us and you, that the *Jīm* is from the World of Witnessing (الشهادة) and the Divine Compulsion (الجبروت). Its point of articulation is the middle of the tongue, between it and the palate. Its numerical value is three. Among its simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Yā’*, the *Mīm*, the *Alif*, and the *Hamza*. It has the Second Sphere, and its years are eleven thousand years. It is distinguished in the common class. It has the middle of the Path. Its level (مرتبته) is the fourth. The manifestation of its dominion is in the Jinn. Its body is cold and dry, and its head is hot and dry. Its nature is coldness, heat, and dryness. Its greatest element is Earth, and the lesser is Fire. Everything that resembles its nature is found through it. Its movement is crooked. It possesses Realities (الحقائق), Stations (*al-Maqāmāt*), and Spiritual Descendings (*al-Munāzalāt*). It is mixed, perfect. It elevates whoever connects to it, according to the People of Lights (أهل الأنوار) and the People of Secrets (أهل الأسرار), except for the Kufans. It is triangular and companionable. Its sign is singularity (*al-fardāniyya*). Among the letters, it has the *Yā’* and the *Mīm*. Among the Names (الأسماء), it has what preceded.

[And from that is the Letter *Shīn* (Dotted with Three Dots)]

> In the *Shīn* are seven secrets for the intelligent,
> And whoever attains them one day has surely reached connection.
> It grants you your Essence (ذاتك) while bodies are quiescent,
> When the Trustee descends upon a heart through it.
> If people were to witness the wonder it contains,
> They would see the crescent of the month’s end having become full.

Know, may Allah support us and you in articulation and understanding, that the *Shīn* is from the World of the Unseen (عالم الغيب) and the Middle Divine Compulsion (الجبروت الأوسط). Its point of articulation is the same as the *Jīm*. Its numerical value is one thousand according to us, and three hundred according to the People of Lights (أهل الأنوار). Among its simple letters (*al-basā’iṭ*), it has the *Yā’*, the *Nūn*, the *Alif*, the *Hamza*, and the *Wāw*. It has the Second Sphere, and the years of this sphere have been mentioned previously. It is distinguished in the common class. It has the middle of the Path. Its level (مرتبته) is the fifth. Its dominion is in the animal kingdom. Its nature is cold and moist. Its element is Water. Everything that resembles its nature is found through it. Its movement is mixed. It is perfect, pure, dual, and companionable. It possesses the Essence (الذات), the Attributes (الصفات), and the Acts (الأفعال). Among the letters, it has the *Yā’* and the *Nūn*. Among the Names (الأسماء), it has what preceded. It possesses character (*al-khuluq*), states (*al-aḥwāl*), and miraculous gifts (*al-karāmāt*).

[And from that is the Letter *Yā’*]

> The *Yā’* of the Message, a letter manifested in the dust,
> Like the *Wāw* residing in the higher world.
> It is the sustainer of bodies that have no shadows,
> And it is the sustainer of hearts that embrace forms.
> When He desires to converse with you through His wisdom,
> He recites, and the secret of the letters and the suras is heard.

Know—may Allah support us and you with a Spirit from Him—that the letter Yā’ (ي) belongs to the World of Witnessing and Power (عالم الشهادة والجبروت). Its point of articulation (مخرج) is the same as that of the Shīn (ش). Its numerical value is ten for the twelve spheres (أفلاك) and one for the seven spheres. Its Simple Letters (بسائطه) are Alif (ا), Hamza (ء), Lām (ل), Fā’ (ف), Hā’ (ه), Mīm (م), and Zāy (ز). Its second sphere (فلكه الثاني) and its years (سنيه) have been mentioned. It is distinguished within the Elite (الخاصة) and the Elite of the Elite (خاصة الخاصة). It possesses the Ultimate Goal (الغاية). Its degree (مرتبته) is the seventh, and the manifestation of its dominion is in Inanimate Objects (الجماد). Its nature (طبعه) is the First Mothers. Its greatest element (عنصره الأعظم) is Fire, and its lesser element is Water. From it, the animal kingdom (الحيوان) comes into existence. Its movement is composite (ممتزجة). It possesses the Realities (الحقائق), Stations (المقامات), and Spiritual Descendings (المنازلات). It is composite (ممتزج), complete (كامل), quaternary (رباعي), and companionable (مؤنس). From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Hamza (ء), and from the Names (الأسماء), what has preceded.

### «And from that is the letter Lām»

> Lām is for the most sublime and holiest Eternity (الأزل السني الأقدس),
> And its station is the highest, the most brilliant, the most precious (البهي الأنفس).
> Whenever it stands, the Creator reveals His Essence (ذاته),
> And whenever the cosmic world (العالم الكوني) sits.
> It grants you a spirit from three realities,
> Walking and trailing in garments of fine silk (السندس).

Know—may Allah support us and you with the Holy Spirit (بروح القدس)—that the letter Lām (ل) belongs to the World of Witnessing and Power (عالم الشهادة والجبروت). Its point of articulation is the edge of the tongue, from its nearest point to the end of its tip. Its numerical value is thirty in the twelve spheres and three in the seven spheres. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Mīm (م), Hamza (ء), Fā’ (ف), and Yā’ (ي). Its second sphere and its years have preceded. It is distinguished within the Elite and the Elite of the Elite. It possesses the Ultimate Goal. Its degree is the fifth. Its dominion is in the Beasts (البهائم). Its nature is heat, cold, and dryness. Its greatest element is Fire, and its lesser element is Earth (التراب). From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is straight and composite. It possesses the Heights (الأعراف). It is composite, complete, singular (مفرد), and alienating (موحش). From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Mīm (م), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the letter Rā’»

> The Rā’ of Love (المحبة) in the station of its union (وصاله),
> Forever in the abode of its bliss, it shall never be forsaken.
> At times it says, "I am the Unique One, and I see none
> Other than Myself," and at times, "O Myself, it shall not be ignorant."
> If your heart were thus with your Lord,
> You would be the closest (المقرب) and the most perfect Beloved (الحبيب الأكملا).

Know—may Allah support us and you with a Spirit from Him—that the letter Rā’ (ر) belongs to the World of Witnessing and Power (عالم الشهادة والجبروت). Its point of articulation is the back of the tongue, above the incisors. Its numerical value is two hundred in the twelve spheres and two in the seven spheres. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Hamza (ء), Lām (ل), Fā’ (ف), Hā’ (ه), Mīm (م), and Zāy (ز). Its second sphere and its years are known. It possesses the Ultimate Goal. Its degree is the seventh. The manifestation of its dominion is in Inanimate Objects (الجماد). It is distinguished within the Elite and the Elite of the Elite. Its nature is heat and dryness. Its element is Fire. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite. It possesses the Heights (الأعراف). It is pure (خالص), deficient (ناقص), sanctified (مقدس), paired (مثنى), and companionable (مؤنس). From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Hamza (ء), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the letter Nūn»

> The Nūn of Existence (الوجود) points its essential dot (نقطة ذاتها)
> In its eye, as an eye, toward its Worshipped One (معبودها).
> Its existence is from His generosity (جوده) and His right hand,
> And all the sublime universes (أكوان العلى) are from its generosity.
> Look with your eye at half the eye of its existence,
> From its generosity, you will stumble upon what is lost (مفقودها).

Know—may Allah support hearts with Spirits—that the letter Nūn (ن) belongs to the World of Dominion and Power (عالم الملك والجبروت). Its point of articulation is the edge of the tongue, above the incisors. Its numerical value is fifty and five. Its Simple Letters are Wāw (و) and Alif (ا). Its second sphere and its movement have been mentioned. It is distinguished within the Elite and the Elite of the Elite. It possesses the Ultimate Goal of the Path (غاية الطريق). Its degree is the second, the Transcendent Degree (المرتبة المنزهة الثانية). The manifestation of its dominion is in the Divine Presence (الحضرة الإلهية). Its nature is coldness and dryness. Its element is Earth. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite. It possesses the Creation (الخلق), the Spiritual States (الأحوال), and the Miraculous Gifts (الكرامات). It is pure, deficient, singular (مفرد), and alienating (موحش). It possesses the Essence (الذات). From the letters, it has the Wāw (و), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the undotted letter Ṭā’»

> In the Ṭā’ are five hidden secrets,
> Among them, the reality of the eye of Dominion (الملك) in the Kingdom (الملك).
> And the Real (الحق) in Creation (الخلق), and the secrets acting as deputies,
> And the Light (النور) in the Fire, and the Human (الإنسان) in the Kingdom.
> These are five; whenever you are charged with them,
> You know that the existence of the sphere (الفلك) is within the sphere.

Know—may Allah support us through it—that the letter Ṭā’ (ط) belongs to the World of Dominion and Power (عالم الملك والجبروت). Its point of articulation is the tip of the tongue and the roots of the incisors. Its numerical value is nine. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Hamza (ء), Lām (ل), Fā’ (ف), Mīm (م), Zāy (ز), and Hā’ (ه). Its second sphere and its years are mentioned. It is distinguished within the Elite and the Elite of the Elite, and it possesses the Ultimate Goal of the Path. Its degree is the seventh. Its dominion is in Inanimate Objects. Its nature is coldness and moisture. Its element is Water. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is straight according to the People of Lights (أهل الأنوار), and crooked according to the People of Secrets (أهل الأسرار), and according to the People of Verification (أهل التحقيق) and us, it is both, and composite. It possesses the Heights (الأعراف). It is pure, complete, paired, and companionable. From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Hamza (ء), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the undotted letter Dāl»

> The Dāl is from the world of formation (الكون) that has moved,
> Away from the substance, so there is neither eye nor trace.
> Its realities are too exalted for any possessor of sight,
> Glory be to Him, He is too majestic for any human to attain Him.
> In it is permanence, for the generosity of the Real (الحق) is its dwelling,
> In it are the repetitions (المثاني), for in it are the verses (الآي) and the chapters (السور).

Know—may Allah support us with His Names—that the letter Dāl (د) belongs to the World of Dominion and Power (عالم الملك والجبروت). Its point of articulation is the same as the Ṭā’. Its numerical value is four. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Lām (ل), Hamza (ء), Fā’ (ف), and Mīm (م). Its first sphere and its years are known. Its movement is twelve thousand years. It possesses the Ultimate Goal of the Path. Its degree is the fifth. Its dominion is in the Beasts. Its nature is coldness and dryness. Its element is Earth. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite between the People of Lights and the People of Secrets. It possesses the Roots (الأعراق). It is pure, deficient, sanctified, paired, and companionable. From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Lām (ل), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the letter Tā’ with two dots above»

> The Tā’ appears sometimes and is concealed sometimes,
> So its share of the people’s existence is fluctuation (تلوين).
> Its presence encompasses the Essence (الذات) and the Attributes (الأوصاف),
> But it has no empowerment in the realm of the Act (الفعل).
> It appears, and from its secrets, wonders manifest,
> And its dominion is the Preserved Tablet (اللوح), the Pens (الأقلام), and the Nūn.
> The Night, the Sun, the Most High, and the Nightcomer (الطارق),
> Are in its Essence, and the Morning Light (الضحى), the Relief (الشرح), and the Fig (التين).

Know, O intimate friend (الولي الحميم), that the letter Tā’ (ت) belongs to the World of the Unseen and Power (عالم الغيب والجبروت). Its point of articulation is the same as the Dāl and the Ṭā’. Its numerical value is four hundred and four. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Hamza (ء), Lām (ل), Fā’ (ف), Hā’ (ه), Mīm (م), and Zāy (ز). Its first sphere and its years have been mentioned. It is distinguished within the Elite of the Elite. Its degree is the seventh. Its dominion is in Inanimate Objects. Its nature is coldness and dryness. Its element is Earth. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite. It possesses the Creation, the Spiritual States, and the Miraculous Gifts. It is pure, complete, quaternary, and companionable. It possesses the Essence and the Attributes (الصفات). From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Hamza (ء), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the dry letter Ṣād»

> In the Ṣād is a light for a heart that watches it,
> During sleep, while the veil of wakefulness conceals it.
> So sleep, for you will meet the light of its prostration,
> Illuminating your breast, while the secrets watch it.
> That light is the light of Gratitude (الشكر), so watch for
> The One who is Thanked (المشكور), for He follows the customs.

Know, O noble chosen one (الصفي الكريم), that the letter Ṣād (ص) belongs to the World of the Unseen and Power (عالم الغيب والجبروت). Its point of articulation is between the tips of the tongue and slightly above the lower incisors. Its numerical value is sixty according to us, and ninety according to the People of Lights. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Dāl (د), Hamza (ء), Lām (ل), and Fā’ (ف). Its first sphere and its years have been mentioned. It is distinguished within the Elite and the Elite of the Elite. It possesses the Beginning of the Path (أول الطريق). Its degree is the fifth. Its dominion is in the Beasts. Its nature is heat and moisture. Its element is Air (الهواء). From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite, unknown. It possesses the Heights (الأعراف). It is pure, complete, paired, and companionable. From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Dāl (د), and from the Names, what has preceded.

Then know that I made the secret of this dry Ṣād (الصاد اليابسة) attainable only in sleep, because I did not attain it, nor did the Real (الحق تعالى) grant it to me, except in a dream. For this reason, I ruled upon it thus, although its reality is not necessarily that; Allah grants it in sleep and wakefulness. When I paused at this point for the transcription, I had some companions read the secrets of the letters to me so that I might correct what had been distorted due to the speed of the pen during transcription. When the reading reached this letter, I told them what had happened to me concerning it, and that sleep was not necessary for its attainment, but that this was how I had received it. I described my state, and the gathering dispersed.

The next day, Saturday, we sat as usual in the assembly in the Sacred Mosque (المسجد الحرام), facing the Yemeni Corner (الركن اليماني) of the Venerable Ka’ba. Shaykh, the Jurist, the resident Abū Yahyā Bakr ibn Abī Abd Allāh al-Hāshimī al-Tuwaytimī al-Tarābulusī (may Allah have mercy on him) used to attend our sessions. He came as was his custom. When we finished the reading, he said to me, "Last night I saw in a dream as if I were sitting, and you were in front of me, lying on your back, mentioning the Ṣād. I recited to you extemporaneously:

> The Ṣād is a noble letter,
> And the Ṣād in the Ṣād is truer.

I asked you in the dream, 'What is your proof?' So I replied:

> Because it is the shape of a circle,
> And nothing precedes the circle.

Then I woke up."

He related to me that in this vision, I was delighted by his answer. When he finished his account, I rejoiced at this good tidings (مبشرة) that he saw concerning me, and at the posture of reclining (الاضطجاع), for that is the sleep of the Prophets (عليهم السلام), and it is the state of the rested one, free from his work, and prepared for the news of heaven that descends upon him through correspondence. Know that the Ṣād is a letter of Truthfulness (الصدق), Preservation (الصون), and Form (الصورة). It is circular in shape, capable of accepting all forms. It contains wondrous secrets. I was astonished by his unveiling (كشفه) in his sleep concerning the state I had mentioned to the companions yesterday in the assembly. <<فَغَفَرْنا لَهُ ذلِكَ وإِنَّ لَهُ عِنْدَنا لَزُلْفى‏ وحُسْنَ مَآبٍ>> (So We forgave him that, and indeed, for him with Us is nearness and a good return). It is a noble, mighty letter. When mentioning it, I swear by the station of the comprehensive words (جوامع الكلم), which is the Muhammadan Witnessing (المشهد المحمدي) at the peak of honor, by the tongue of glorification. This Sūra encompasses descriptions of the Prophets (عليهم السلام) and wondrous, hidden secrets of the entire cosmos, signs and marvels. This vision contains secrets corresponding to the secrets in this Sūra. It indicates great and immense good that will be attained by the seer and the one for whom the vision was seen, and everyone witnessed in it from Allah the Exalted. They will receive blessings from the Prophets mentioned in this Sūra, and the enemies among the disbelievers will be afflicted by the misery mentioned in this Sūra, but not the believers. We ask Allah for well-being for us and for them in this world and the Hereafter.

This is a glad tiding that occurred, and secrets that the Real sent to us through the hand of this seer. Our companion Abū Yahyā, the seer, told me that when he woke up, he completed the two verses he had recited to me in the dream with a poem. I asked him to send it to me so that I could transcribe it in this book immediately following this vision and concerning this letter, for that poem is an inspiration from this spiritual reality (الحقيقة الروحانية) that he saw in the dream. I wished not to separate them. So I sent our companion Abū Abd Allāh Muhammad ibn Khālid al-Sūfī al-Tilimsānī with him, and he brought it to me. It is this:

> The Ṣād is a noble letter,
> And the Ṣād in the Ṣād is truer.
> Say, "What is the proof?" I find it
> Affixed within the heart.
> Because it is the shape of a circle,
> And nothing precedes the circle.
> This indicates that I
> Am successful upon the Path.
> I verified my intention in Allah,
> And the Real (الحق) is intended by the truth.
> If there is depth in the sea,
> The shore of the heart is deeper.
> If your heart is too narrow for me,
> The heart of another is narrower.
> Leave the companions and accept
> From a truthful one who gives charity.
> Do not oppose, lest you suffer,
> For the heart is attached to me.
> Open it, expand it, and act
> The action of one who has verified.
> How long, O hard-hearted one,
> Is the door of your heart locked?
> The action of others is pure,
> While the face of your action is blue (i.e., gloomy).
> We are gentle, so be gentle,
> For gentleness in gentleness is gentler.
> If you come, We shall clothe you
> In a garment of aged kindness.
> Do not be like Jarīr,
> When he kept satirizing Al-Farazdaq.
> But satirize with my praise, for my praise
> Is brighter than the rising sun.
> I am Existence (الوجود) by My Essence (بذاتي),
> And the Verified Existence (الوجود المحقق) belongs to Me.
> Without restriction, like My Knowledge,
> It is absolute (مطلق) upon the Reality (الحقيقة).
> Do you see the king ever
> Being plotted against by a single weakling?
> Whoever speaks against Me with his opinion,
> The speaker of that opinion is foolish.
> If he keeps raving due to illusion,
> I see him boasting.
> And every word that is spoken,
> The Remembrance (الذكر) is truer than that.
> I am the Guardian (المهيمن), Possessor of the Throne,
> I do not perish, and I create.
> I sent My Messengers to creation,
> And Ahmad (Muhammad) came with the Truth (الحق).
> He stood up for Me with truthfulness,
> And when he thundered, he flashed lightning.
> Striving against the enemies,
> And advising what was revealed.
> Had I not aided them with My servant,
> I would have drowned those who do not drown.
> Indeed, the heavens and the earth
> Flee from My punishment.
> And if you obey, I shall gather
> What is scattered.
> And I shall gather all in Eternity (الخلد),
> In fragrant gardens.
> All hearts are upon this,
> And I am Allah, I clap.
> So I rose from my state of sleep,
> And my palms were clapping.

### «And from that is the letter Zāy»

> In the Zāy is a secret; if you verify its meaning,
> The realities of the spirit of the Command (الأمر) are its wealth.
> If it discloses itself (تجلى) to a heart by its wisdom,
> Upon annihilation (الفناء) from transcendence (التنزيه), it enriches it.
> There is none among the letters of the Transcendent Essence (الذات النزيهة) who
> Verifies Knowledge (العلم) or comprehends it, except it.

Know—may Allah support you with the Spirit of Eternity (روح الأزل)—that the letter Zāy (ز) belongs to the World of Witnessing, Power, and Compulsion (عالم الشهادة والجبروت والقهر). Its point of articulation is the same as the Ṣād and the Sīn. Its numerical value is seven. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Yā’ (ي), Hamza (ء), Lām (ل), and Fā’ (ف). Its sphere is the First Sphere. The mention of its movement has preceded. It is distinguished within the Quintessence of the Elite of the Elite (خلاصة خاصة الخاصة). It possesses the Ultimate Goal. Its degree is the fifth. Its dominion is in the Beasts. Its nature is heat and dryness. Its element is Fire. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite. It possesses the Creation, the Spiritual States, and the Miraculous Gifts. It is pure, deficient, sanctified, paired, and companionable. From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Yā’ (ي), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the undotted letter Sīn»

> In the Sīn are the four secrets of Existence (الوجود),
> And for it is Verification (التحقق) and the highest Station (المقام الأرفع).
> From the World of the Unseen (عالم الغيب) through which appeared
> The traces of a cosmos whose sun is veiled.

Know that the letter Sīn (س) belongs to the World of the Unseen, Power, and Subtlety (عالم الغيب والجبروت واللطف). Its point of articulation is the same as the Ṣād and the Zāy. Its numerical value is sixty and six according to the People of Lights, and three hundred and three according to us. Its Simple Letters are Yā’ (ي), Nūn (ن), Alif (ا), Hamza (ء), and Wāw (و). Its first sphere and its years are mentioned. It is distinguished within the Elite, the Elite of the Elite, the Quintessence of the Elite of the Elite, and the Purity of the Quintessence of the Elite of the Elite. It possesses the Ultimate Goal. Its degree is the fifth. The manifestation of its dominion is in the Beasts. Its nature is heat and dryness. Its element is Fire. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite. It possesses the Heights (الأعراف). It is pure, complete, paired, and companionable. From the letters, it has the Yā’ (ي) and the Nūn (ن), and from the Divine Names (الأسماء الإلهية), what has preceded.

### «And from that is the dotted letter Ẓā’»

> In the Ẓā’ are six concealed secrets,
> Hidden, having no specific designation in creation.
> Except metaphorically, when it bestows its bounty,
> An improvement is seen in the manifestation of the eye.
> It hopes in God and fears His justice, and if
> It is absent from its cosmos, no formation (تكوين) appears.

Know, O intelligent one (العاقل), that the letter Ẓā’ (ظ) belongs to the World of Witnessing, Power, and Compulsion (عالم الشهادة والجبروت والقهر). Its point of articulation is between the tips of the tongue and the edges of the incisors. Its numerical value is eight hundred and eight according to us, and nine hundred according to the People of Lights. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Lām (ل), Hamza (ء), Fā’ (ف), Hā’ (ه), Mīm (م), and Zāy (ز). Its first sphere and its years are mentioned. It is distinguished within the Quintessence of the Elite of the Elite. It possesses the Ultimate Goal of the Path. Its degree is the seventh. Its dominion is in Inanimate Objects. The nature of its circle is cold and moist, and its upright part is hot and moist. Thus, it possesses heat, cold, and moisture. Its greatest element is Water, and its lesser element is Air. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite. It possesses the Creation, the Spiritual States, and the Miraculous Gifts. It is composite, complete, paired, and companionable. It possesses the Essence. From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Hamza (ء), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the dotted letter Dhāl»

> The Dhāl descends sometimes upon my body
> By compulsion, and descends sometimes upon my mind (خلدي)
> By choice, and is annihilated from both this and that, so
> No trace of nearness (الزلفى) is seen upon anyone.
> He is the Imām (الإمام) who has no equal,
> His Names call Him the One, the Eternal Refuge (الواحد الصمد).

Know, O Imām, that the letter Dhāl (ذ) belongs to the World of Witnessing, Power, and Compulsion (عالم الشهادة والجبروت والقهر). Its point of articulation is the same as the Ẓā’. Its numerical value is seven hundred and seven. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Lām (ل), Hamza (ء), Fā’ (ف), and Mīm (م). Its first sphere and its movement are mentioned. It is distinguished within the General Public (العامة). It possesses the Middle of the Path (وسط الطريق). Its degree is the fifth. Its dominion is in the Beasts. Its nature is heat and moisture. Its element is Air. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is crooked and composite. It possesses the Creation, the Spiritual States, and the Miraculous Gifts. It is pure, complete, sanctified, paired, and companionable. It possesses the Essence. From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Lām (ل), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the letter Thā’ with three dots»

> The Thā’ is essential in Attributes (ذاتية الأوصاف), lofty
> In description and Act (الفعل), and the Pens (الأقلام) bring it into existence.
> If it discloses itself (تجلت) by the secret of the Essence (الذات) as one,
> On the Day of Beginning, creation worships it.
> And if it discloses itself by the secret of the Attribute (الوصف) as second,
> On the Day of Mediation, the description praises it.
> And if it discloses itself by the secret of the Act (الفعل) as third,
> On the Day of Tuesday, the cosmos is blessed by it.

Know, O Master (السيد), that the letter Thā’ (ث) belongs to the World of the Unseen, Power, and Subtlety (عالم الغيب والجبروت واللطف). Its point of articulation is the same as the Ẓā’ and the Dhāl. Its numerical value is five hundred and five. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Hamza (ء), Lām (ل), Fā’ (ف), Hā’ (ه), Mīm (م), and Zāy (ز). It has the First Sphere, and its years are mentioned. It is distinguished within the Quintessence of the Elite of the Elite. It possesses the Ultimate Goal of the Path. Its degree is the seventh. Its dominion is in Inanimate Objects. Its nature is coldness and dryness. Its element is Earth. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite. It possesses the Creation, the Spiritual States, and the Miraculous Gifts. It is pure, complete, quaternary (مربع), and companionable. It possesses the Essence, the Attributes, and the Acts. From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Hamza (ء), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the letter Fā’»

> The Fā’ is from the World of Verification (عالم التحقيق), so remember,
> And look at its secret; it comes according to measure.
> It has a mixture with the Yā’ (ي) in Existence (الوجود), so it does not
> Separate from the mixture concerning the Real (حق) and the human (بشر).
> If you cut off the union of the Yā’, there will submit to it
> From the faces of the world of Spirits (الأرواح) and Forms (الصور).

Know—may Allah support the Divine Heart (القلب الإلهي)—that the letter Fā’ (ف) belongs to the World of Witnessing, Power, the Unseen, and Subtlety (عالم الشهادة والجبروت والغيب واللطف). Its point of articulation is the inner part of the lower lip and the edges of the upper incisors. Its numerical value is eighty and eight. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Hamza (ء), Lām (ل), Fā’ (ف), Hā’ (ه), Mīm (م), and Zāy (ز). It has the First Sphere, and its years have been mentioned. It is distinguished within the Quintessence (الخلاصة). It possesses the Ultimate Goal of the Path. Its degree is the seventh. Its dominion is in Inanimate Objects. The nature of its head is heat and moisture, and the rest of its body is cold and moist. Thus, its nature is heat, cold, and moisture. Its greatest element is Water, and its lesser element is Air. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite. It possesses the Realities, Stations, and Spiritual Descendings according to the People of Secrets, and it possesses the Creation, the Spiritual States, and the Miraculous Gifts according to the People of Lights. It is composite, complete, singular, paired, companionable, and alienating (موحش). It possesses the Essence. From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Hamza (ء), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the letter Bā’ with one dot»

> The Bā’ is considered by the Gnostic al-Shiblī,
> And in its dot is a reminder for the heart.
> The secret of the Highest Servitude (العبودية العليا) is mixed with it,
> Therefore, it acted as a deputy for the Real (الحق), so consider!
> Is it not omitted from the reality of *Bism* (بسم)
> Because it is a substitute for Him? That is a burden.

Know, O Exalted Governor (الوالي المتعالي), that the letter Bā’ (ب) belongs to the World of Dominion, Witnessing, and Compulsion (عالم الملك والشهادة والقهر). Its point of articulation is the two lips. Its numerical value is two. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Hamza (ء), Lām (ل), Fā’ (ف), Hā’ (ه), Mīm (م), and Zāy (ز). Its first sphere has the mentioned movement. It is distinguished within the very Purity of the Quintessence (عين صفاء الخلاصة) and within the Elite of the Elite. It possesses the Beginning of the Path and its Ultimate Goal. Its degree is the seventh. Its dominion is in Inanimate Objects. Its nature is heat and dryness. Its element is Fire. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite. It possesses the Realities, Stations, and Spiritual Descendings. It is pure, complete, quaternary, and companionable. It possesses the Essence. From the letters, it has the Alif (ا) and the Hamza (ء), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the letter Mīm»

> The Mīm is like the Nūn if you verify their secret,
> In the ultimate end of the cosmos, as an eye, and in the beginnings.
> The Nūn is for the Real (الحق), and the noble Mīm is for me,
> A beginning for a beginning, and ultimate ends for ultimate ends.
> The Isthmus (برزخ) of the Nūn is a spirit in its gnoses (معارفه),
> And the Isthmus of the Mīm is a Lord (رب) in the created beings (البريات).

Know—may Allah support the believer—that the letter Mīm (م) belongs to the World of Dominion, Witnessing, and Compulsion (عالم الملك والشهادة والقهر). Its point of articulation is the same as the Bā’. Its numerical value is forty-four. Its Simple Letters are Yā’ (ي), Alif (ا), and Hamza (ء). Its first sphere and its years are mentioned. It is distinguished within the Elite, the Quintessence, and the Purity of the Quintessence. It possesses the Ultimate Goal. Its degree is the third. The manifestation of its dominion is in the Human (الإنسان). Its nature is coldness and dryness. Its element is Earth. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. It possesses the Heights (الأعراف). It is pure, complete, sanctified, singular, and companionable. From the letters, it has the Yā’ (ي), and from the Names, what has preceded.

### «And from that is the letter Wāw»

> The Wāw of "You" (إياك) is holier
> Than my existence and more precious.
> It is a complete spirit,
> And it is a six-sided secret.
> Wherever its eye shines,
> It is said to be a sacred house.
> Its house is the lofty Lote Tree (السدرة العلية),
> Established within us.

The Wāw (و) belongs to the World of Dominion, Witnessing, and Compulsion (عالم الملك والشهادة والقهر). Its point of articulation is the two lips. Its numerical value is six. Its Simple Letters are Alif (ا), Hamza (ء), Lām (ل), and Fā’ (ف). Its first sphere and its years are mentioned. It is distinguished within the Elite of the Elite and the Quintessence. It possesses the Ultimate Goal of the Path. Its degree is the fourth. Its dominion is in the Jinn (الجن). Its nature is heat and moisture. Its element is Air. From it comes into existence that which resembles its nature. Its movement is composite. It possesses the Roots (الأعراق). It is pure, deficient, sanctified, singular, and alienating (موحش). From the letters, it has the Alif (ا), and from the Names, what has preceded.

These are the letters of the alphabet, completed by mentioning the indications and warnings revealed to us for the People of Unveiling (أهل الكشف), seclusion (الخلوات), and those who gain insight into the secrets of existing things (الموجودات). If you wish to make their comprehension easier for you in terms of expressing them, know their commonality in the spheres of the Simple Letters (أفلاك البسائط), so that you may know the realities of the Names that sustain them. The discussion concerning the Alif has preceded, and likewise the Hamza enters with the weak letters Alif, Wāw, and Yā’, thus they are also excluded from the ruling of the letters in this respect. The Jīm (ج), Zāy (ز), Lām (ل), Mīm (م), and Nūn (ن) have different Simple Letters. The Dāl (د) and Dhāl (ذ) are similar. The Ṣād (ص) and Ḍād (ض) are similar. The ‘Ayn (ع), Ghayn (غ), Sīn (س), and Shīn (ش) are similar. The Wāw (و), Kāf (ك), and Qāf (ق) are similar. The Bā’ (ب), Hā’ (ه), Hā’ (ح), Ṭā’ (ط), Yā’ (ي), Fā’ (ف), Rā’ (ر), Tā’ (ت), Thā’ (ث), Khā’ (خ), and Ẓā’ (ظ) also have similar Simple Letters. Know that every letter with similar Simple Letters has similar Names. We mentioned that we would discuss Lām-Alif (لام ألف) following the letters, as it is analogous to the Jawzahar (the lunar node), so we shall mention it separately from the letters in the numbering, for it is an added, composite letter formed from Alif and Lām, and from Hamza and Lām.

### «Mention of Lām-Alif and Alif-Lām»

> Alif-Lām and Lām-Alif,
> Are the river of Tālūt (Saul), so do not scoop.
> Drink the river to its end,
> And do not deviate from gluttony.
> And stand as long as you are quenched, but if
> Your soul thirsts, stand up and depart.
> Know that Allah sent it
> As a river of trial for the heart of the observer.
> So be patient in Allah and beware of Him, for
> The servant may be forsaken if he does not stand.

### «Knowledge of Lām-Alif (لا)»

> The Alif embraces the Lām, the Sign,
> Like two lovers, and the years are dreams.
> And the leg was wrapped around the leg (وَالْتَفَّتِ السَّاقُ بِالسَّاقِ) which was mighty,
> And from them came to me, in the wrapping, an announcement.
> That if the heart embraces its meaning,
> Creation (إيجاد) and annihilation (إعدام) appear within it.

Know that when the Alif and the Lām accompanied each other, each of them was accompanied by an inclination (ميل), which is passion (الهوى) and purpose (الغرض). Inclination only arises from a movement of love (‘ishqīyya). The movement of the Lām is an essential movement (حركة ذاتية), and the movement of the Alif is an accidental movement (حركة عرضية). Thus, the dominion of the Lām appeared over the Alif in generating movement within it. The Lām, in this chapter, was stronger than the Alif because it is more in love, so its aspiration (همتها) is more complete in existence and more perfect in action. The Alif is less in love, so its aspiration is less attached to the Lām, and it could not straighten its crookedness. The possessor of aspiration necessarily possesses the Act, according to the People of Verification (المحققين). This is the portion and station of the Sūfī, and he cannot exceed it to another.

If he moves to the station of the People of Verification, the gnosis of the Verifier is above that. This is because the inclination of the Alif is not due to the Lām acting upon it through its aspiration; rather, its inclination is its descent (نزوله) to the Lām through subtle graces (الألطاف) due to the establishment of the Lām’s love within it. Do you not see that it has twisted its leg around the upright part of the Alif and bent over it, fearing loss? Thus, the inclination of the Alif toward it is a descent, like the descent of the Real (الحق) to the lowest heaven (السماء الدنيا)—and they are the People of the Night in the last third. The inclination of the Lām is known to both of them, being caused and compelled, and there is no disagreement among us concerning it, except regarding the specific motive (الباعث). The Sūfī makes the inclination of the Lām the inclination of the Finders (الواجدين) and those who seek finding (المتواجدين), due to its verification among them in the station of love and mutual love, and its spiritual state (حاله). The inclination of the Alif is the inclination of connection and union (التواصل والاتحاد). For this reason, they resemble each other in form, thus: لآ. Whichever you designate as the Alif or the Lām first, that is the designation. This is why the People of Language (أهل اللسان) differed on where to place the movement of the Lām or the Hamza that is on the Alif. One group considered the pronunciation, saying the Lām is first and the Alif is after. Another group considered the script, saying whichever branch the scribe begins with is the Lām, and the second is the Alif.

All of this is granted by the state of love. Truthfulness in love generates turning toward the Beloved (المعشوق) in search, and truthful turning generates union (الوصال) from the Beloved to the lover. The Verifier says that the motive for inclination is Gnosis (المعرفة) for both, and each according to its reality.

As for us, and those who ascend with us in the high degrees of Verification (التحقيق) above which there are no degrees, we do not agree with either of their sayings. Rather, we have a detailed explanation of the matter. This is that you must observe in which Presence (حضرة) they met. For love is a partial Presence among the total Presences. Thus, the Sūfī’s saying is true. And Gnosis is also a Presence, thus the Verifier’s saying is true. But each of them falls short of Verification in this matter, looking with only one eye.

We say that the first Presence in which they met is the Presence of Bringing into Existence (حضرة الإيجاد), which is *Lā Ilāha Illā Allāh* (لا إلاه إل لا أل لاه). This is the Presence of the Creator and the creation. The word *Lā* (لا) appeared in negation twice, and in affirmation twice: *Lā Lā Lā* and *Ilāh Lāh*. The inclination of Absolute Existence (الوجود المطلق), which is the Alif in this Presence, is toward bringing into existence, and the inclination of Restricted Existence (الموجود المقيد), which is the Lām, is toward bringing into existence at the moment of bringing into existence. For this reason, it came out in this form. Every reality of them is absolute in its rank, so understand if you are capable of understanding. Otherwise, adhere to seclusion (الخلوة) and attach your aspiration to Allah, the Merciful, until you know.

When it becomes restricted after its existence has been determined and its essence has appeared to its eye, then:

> For the Real (الحق) there is the Real, and for the human there is the human,
> At the moment of Existence (الوجود), and for the Quran there is the Quran.
> And for direct vision (العيان) there is direct vision in the Witnessing (الشهود), just as
> During intimate converse (المناجاة), for the ears there are ears.
> So look at us with the eye of Gathering (الجمع) to attain us
> In Separation (الفرق), so adhere to it, for the Quran is Separation (فرقان).

There must be an attribute that subsists in it, by which it corresponds to its like or its opposite from the Divine Presence (الحضرة الإلهية). I only mentioned the opposite and did not restrict myself to the like, which is the True Real (الحق الصدق), out of a desire to correct the heart of the Sūfī and the one who is established in the first degrees of Verification. Their source of drinking is this, and they do not know what is above it, nor what we hint at, until He takes them by the hands and makes them witness what He has made us witness. I shall mention a part of that in the third section of this chapter, so seek it there, if Allah wills.

Dive into the sea of the Glorious Quran if you have a vast soul (واسع النفس). Otherwise, restrict yourself to studying the books of the commentators on its outward meaning, and do not dive, lest you perish. For the sea of the Quran is deep. Were it not for the diver who seeks the places near the shore, nothing would ever come out for you. The Prophets and the preserving inheritors are the ones who seek these places, out of mercy for the world. As for the standers—those who reached and held fast but did not return—no one benefited from them, nor did they benefit from anyone. They were intended, or rather, they were intended for the deepest part of the sea, so they dove forever, never emerging.

May Allah have mercy on the servants. I recall Shaykh Sahl ibn Abd Allāh al-Tustarī when he said "forever" to Sahl, when Sahl asked him, "Does the heart prostrate?" The Shaykh replied, "Forever." Rather, may Allah bless the Messenger of Allah when he was asked concerning the inclusion of the Minor Pilgrimage (‘Umra) in the Major Pilgrimage (Hajj), "Is this for our year, or forever?" The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Rather, forever, forever."

It is a spiritual reality (روحانية) remaining in the Abode of Eternity (دار الخلد). The People of Paradise (أهل الجنان) find it every estimated year, and they say, "What is this?" They are answered: "The ‘Umra in the Hajj is a spirit, a delight, and a noble, honorable incoming grace (وارد نزيه شريف) by which the features of the faces shine and increase in beauty and grace."

So, if you dive—may Allah grant you success—into the sea of the Quran, seek and search for these two shells of mine, the two rubies: the Alif and the Lām. Their shell is the word or the verse that carries them. If it is a verbal word, their relation to that station is according to its layers. If it is a nominal word, their relation to that station is according to its layers. If it is an essential word, its relation is according to that, as the Prophet (peace be upon him) indicated.

If it is not in the letter: *A‘ūdhu bi-riḍāka min sakhaṭika* (I seek refuge in Your pleasure from Your displeasure). *Bi-riḍāka* (in Your pleasure) is the inclination of the Alif. *Min sakhaṭika* (from Your displeasure) is the inclination of the Lām—a nominal word. *Wa-bi-mu‘āfātika min ‘uqūbatika* (And in Your pardon from Your punishment). *Bi-mu‘āfātika* is the inclination of the Alif. *Min ‘uqūbatika* is the inclination of the Lām—a verbal word. *Wa-bika minka* (And by You, from You). *Bika* is the inclination of the Alif. *Minka* is the inclination of the Lām—an essential word.

Look at how wondrous the secret of Prophethood is, how lofty it is, how low its aim is, and how far its reach is! Whoever speaks about the two letters Lām-Alif from without looking at the Presence in which it exists is not complete. Far be it! The Lām-Alif of <<لا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ>> (no fear upon them) is never equal to the Lām-Alif of <<وَلا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ>> (nor shall they grieve), just as the Lām-Alif of negation (لا) is not equal to the Lām-Alif of affirmation (لا), just as the Lām-Alif of simple negation is not equal to the Lām-Alif of negation and disavowal (التبرئة) and the Lām-Alif of prohibition (النهي). For it is raised (marfū‘) by negation, made accusative (manṣūb) by disavowal, and made jussive (majzūm) by prohibition. And the Lām-Alif of the definite article (لام التعريف) is not equal to the Alif that is part of the root of the word, such as His saying: <<الْأَعْرافِ>> (The Heights), <<الْأَدْبارَ>> (the backs), <<الْأَبْصارِ>> (the sights), and <<الْأَقْلامِ>> (the Pens). Just as the Lām-Alif of the Lām of emphasis (لام التوكيد) is not equal to the original Alif, such as His saying, the Exalted: <<لَأَوْضَعُوا>> (they would certainly have hurried) and <<لَأَنْتُمْ>> (you are certainly).

Verify what we have mentioned to you, and raise your Alif from its slumber, and untie your Lām from its knot. In the knotting of the Lām with the Alif is a secret that does not manifest, and I cannot elaborate on the expressions concerning the stations of Lām-Alif as they occurred in the Quran, unless the listener were hearing it from me just as he hears it from the one upon whom it was revealed, if he were to express it. Nevertheless, the purpose of this book is brevity, and the chapter has become long, and the discussion in it has expanded in a general way due to the multiplicity of degrees and the multiplicity of letters.

We have not mentioned in this chapter the knowledge of the suitability (المناسبة) between the letters so that their connection with one another may be sound, nor have we mentioned the combination of two letters together, except Lām-Alif specifically, in a certain respect. This chapter contains three thousand five hundred and forty issues, corresponding to the number of connections in some way, with each connection having a specific knowledge. Under each of these issues are many branching sub-issues, for every letter associates with all other letters in terms of its nominative, accusative, genitive, and jussive states, its essence, and the three weak letters. Whoever wishes to be fully satisfied by them should study the commentary on the Glorious Quran that we named *Al-Jam‘ wa al-Tafṣīl* (The Gathering and the Detail). We shall fulfill the purpose concerning these letters, if Allah wills, in our book *Al-Mabādī wa al-Ghāyāt* (The Beginnings and the Ends), which is currently in our possession. Let this indication concerning Lām-Alif suffice. And praise be to Allah, the Bestower of Favor.

### «Knowledge of Alif-Lām (آل)»

> Alif-Lām is for the gnosis of the Essences (الذوات),
> And for reviving the decayed bones (العظام النخرات).
> It organizes the scattered whole when it appears
> With its countenance, and leaves no dispersion.
> It fulfills the covenant truthfully, and for it is
> A state of magnifying the existence of the Presences (الحضرات).

Know that Lām-Alif, after its untying, the dismantling of its form, the manifestation of its secrets, and its annihilation from its name and script, appears in the Presence of Genus (الجنس), Covenant (العهد), Definition (التعريف), and Magnification (التعظيم). This is because the Alif is the portion of the Real (الحق) and the Lām is the portion of the Human. Thus, the Alif and the Lām are for the Genus. When the Alif and the Lām are mentioned, the entire cosmos and its Creator are mentioned. If you are annihilated from the Real by the creation, and you mention the Alif and the Lām, then the Alif and the Lām are the Real and the Creation (الخلق). This is the Genus according to us.

The upright part of the Lām is for Allah the Exalted, and the half-circle of the sensible Lām that remains after the Alif takes its upright part is the shape of the Nūn for the Creation. The spiritual, unseen half-circle is for the Kingdom (الملكوت). The Alif that manifests is the diameter of the circle for the Command (الأمر), which is <<كُنْ>> (Be!). These are all types and sections of the Most General Genus (الجنس الأعم) above which there is no genus, which is the Reality of Realities (حقيقة الحقائق), the wandering one (التائهة), ancient in the Ancient (القديم) but not in its essence, and originated in the originated but not in its essence. When viewed in itself, it is neither existent nor non-existent, and if it is not existent, it is not described by ancientness or origination, as its mention will come in the sixth chapter of this book.

It possesses what resembles it in terms of its acceptance of forms, but not in terms of its acceptance of origination and ancientness. For that which resembles it is existent, and every existent is either originated (محدث) which is the creation (الخلق), or the originator (محدث اسم فاعل) which is the Creator (الخالق). Since it accepts ancientness and origination, the Real discloses Himself (يتجلى) to His servants according to whichever of His Attributes He wills. For this reason, some people deny Him in the Hereafter, because He discloses Himself to them in a form and attribute other than the one they knew Him by. A part of this has preceded in the first chapter of this book. He discloses Himself to the Gnostics (العارفين) upon their hearts and upon their essences generally in the Hereafter. This is one aspect of resemblance.

According to the Verification (التحقيق) that is clear to us, their realities are what disclose themselves to both groups in both abodes—for those who understand or comprehend from Allah the Exalted—the One seen in this world by hearts and sights, even though He, glory be to Him, informs of the inability of servants to grasp His essence, saying: <<لا تُدْرِكُهُ الْأَبْصارُ وهُوَ يُدْرِكُ الْأَبْصارَ وهُوَ اللَّطِيفُ الْخَبِيرُ>> (Vision comprehends Him not, but He comprehends [all] vision; and He is the Subtle, the Acquainted). He is Subtle (لطيف) with His servants by disclosing Himself to them according to their capacity, and Acquainted (خبير) with their weakness in bearing His Most Holy Self-disclosure (تجليه الأقدس) according to what Divinity (الألوهة) requires, for the originated has no capacity to bear the beauty of the Ancient, just as rivers have no capacity to bear the seas. For the seas annihilate their essences, whether they flow into it or it flows into them—I mean the sea—no trace remains to be witnessed or distinguished.

Know and verify what we have mentioned. The highest of originated things that resembles it is the Dust (الهباء) in which the forms of the world were created. Then the Light (النور) is lower than it in resemblance to it, for the Light is a form in the Dust, just as the Dust is a form in it. Lower in resemblance than the Light is the Air (الهواء), and lower than that is Water, and lower than that are Minerals, and lower than that are wood and its likes, until it ends at something that accepts only one form, if you find it. So understand this until its chapter comes in this book, if Allah wills.

This wandering Reality (الحقيقة التائهة) that encompasses the wandering realities is the Most General Genus (الجنس الأعم) that deserves the Alif and the Lām to be carried upon it by its essence. Likewise, their covenant (عهدهما) is due to the flow of their reality upon the knowledge of what the covenant occurred upon between the existing things. So, upon whichever two existing things they enter for a matter that existed between them, from the perspective of each one regarding a third matter, they are for the covenant of that third matter which they both know.

According to their reality, the Alif is for taking the covenant, and the Lām is for the one upon whom the covenant is taken. Likewise, their definition (تعريفهما) and specification (تخصيصهما) only specify something from its genus by designation, so that knowledge of it may be attained by the one whom the informant wishes to inform. So, according to whatever state the specifier, the specified, and the thing due to which these two realities appeared were in, they transform into the form of their realities. This is the essential commonality (الاشتراك الذاتي).

If the commonality is in the Attribute, and we wish to distinguish the greater of the two for the addressee, then they are for Magnification (التعظيم) in the attribute they enter upon. The Alif and the Lām accept every form and reality because they are existent, comprehensive of all realities. Whatever manifests, the God of the reality that is with them manifests from it, and they correspond to it. Their indication of the thing is due to their own essence, not that they acquired it from the thing they entered upon. Examples of this are: *Ahlaka al-nāsa al-dīnāru wa al-dirhamu* (The Dinar and the Dirham destroyed the people); *Ra’aytu al-rajula amsi* (I saw the man yesterday); *Aḥbabtu al-rijāla dūna al-nisā’* (I loved the men, not the women); *Hawaytu al-simāna* (I desired the fat ones). This much suffices, for the chapter has become long. End of the Sixth Part. And praise be to Allah, the Bestower of Favor.

Explanation of some reasons, meaning the interpretation of the terms mentioned in the letters: Simple Letters (بسائط), Degrees (مراتب), Sanctification (تقديس), Singularity (إفراد), Composition (تركيب), Companionability (أنس), Alienation (وحشة), and so forth.

### [The Chain of the Unseen in the World of Letters (سلسة الغيب في عالم الحروف)]

Know first that since these letters are like the human, responsible world (العالم المكلف الإنساني), sharing in the address but not in the responsibility, due to their acceptance of all realities, like the human—while the rest of the world is not like that—among them is the Pole (القطب), just as among us, and that is the Alif. The station of the Pole among us is the Sustaining Life (الحياة القيومية). This is its specific station, for it traveled with its aspiration throughout the entire world. Likewise, the Alif in every respect, from the perspective of its spirituality (روحانيته) that we perceive but others do not, and from the perspective of its flow as a breath (نفسا) from the furthest point of articulation, which is the source of the breath, to the last point of articulation, extending into the outgoing air while you are silent—this is what is called the echo (الصدى). That is the Sustaining Quality (قيومية) of the Alif, not that it is stationary.

And from the perspective of its script (رقمه), all letters resolve into it and are composed from it, but it does not resolve into them, just as it also resolves into its spirituality, which is the Point (النقطة) by estimation. Even though the One does not resolve, we have informed you why the Alif is the Pole. Act similarly in what we mention to you after this if you wish to know its reality.

(The Two Imāms) are the two weak letters Wāw (و) and Yā’ (ي), which are the letters of lengthening and softness (المد واللين), not the sound ones. (The Pegs/Pillars - الأوتاد) are four: Alif, Wāw, Yā’, and Nūn, which are the signs of inflection (الإعراب). (The Substitutes - الأبدال) are seven: Alif, Wāw, Yā’, Nūn, the Tā’ of the pronoun, the Kāf, and its Hā’. The Alif is the Alif of *rajulān* (two men), the Wāw is the Wāw of *‘Amrūn* (Amr), the Yā’ is the Yā’ of *‘Amrayn* (two Amrs), and the Nūn is the Nūn of *yaf‘alūn* (they do).

The secret of the relationship between us and them in the rank of the Substitutes is as we explained regarding the Pole: when the Tā’ is absent from *qumtu* (I stood), it leaves its substitute, so the speaker says *qāma Zayd* (Zayd stood), and it acts as a deputy for the letters that constitute the name of the person being reported about. Even if the name were composed of a thousand letters, the pronoun would act as a deputy for the entirety of those letters, due to the strength of the pronoun letters, their establishment, and the vastness of their sphere. If you named a man, "O dwelling of Mayya in the high ground, the support," the Tā’ or the Kāf or the Hā’ would act as a deputy for the totality of these letters in indication, leaving it as its substitute, or coming as a substitute for it, however you wish. This is only valid for them because they know that, while the one they substitute for, or who substitutes for them, does not know it. For this reason, they and their sisters deserved the station of the Substitutes (الأبدال). The comprehension of how this knowledge is attained depends on Unveiling (الكشف), so seek it through seclusion, remembrance (الذكر), and aspiration (الهمة).

### [Repetition of Letters in the Stations (تكرار الحروف في المقامات)]

Beware of imagining that the repetition of these letters in the stations means they are one thing with multiple facets. Rather, they are like human individuals. Zayd ibn ‘Alī is not the exact essence of his second brother, Zayd ibn ‘Alī, even though they share in sonship and humanity, and their father is one. But we know by necessity that the first brother is not the exact essence of the second brother. Just as sight distinguishes between them, so too does knowledge distinguish between them in the letters, according to the People of Unveiling, from the perspective of Unveiling, and according to those who descend from this degree, from the perspective of the station that substitutes for its letters.

The possessor of Unveiling adds another matter that the possessor of the knowledge of the mentioned station does not know. For example, if you repeat the word *qultu* (I said) as a substitute for a specific name, you say to a specific person, "You said such-and-such, and you said such-and-such." The Tā’ in the first *qultu*, according to the possessor of Unveiling, is different from the Tā’ in the second *qultu*, because the essence of the addressee is renewed in every breath. Rather, <<بَلْ هُمْ فِي لَبْسٍ مِنْ خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ>> (Nay, but they are in confusion regarding a new creation). This is the way of the Real in the world with the oneness of the substance.

Likewise, the spiritual movement (الحركة الروحانية) from which the Real created the first Tā’ is different from the movement from which He created the other Tā’, no matter how far it reaches, so its meaning necessarily differs. The possessor of the knowledge of the station notices the difference in the knowledge of the meaning, but he does not notice the difference in the Tā’ or any other letter, whether it is a pronoun or not, for he is merely a possessor of script and pronunciation, just as the Ash‘arites say regarding accidents (الأعراض). People agree with them on this regarding movement specifically, but they do not reach the knowledge of this in anything other than movement. For this reason, they denied it and did not affirm it, attributing the one who affirms it to delusion and denial of the senses. They were veiled from perceiving the weakness of their intellects, the corruption of their perspective, and their inability to manipulate meanings. If they had attained the first point through genuine Unveiling from its source, that reality would have extended to all accidents as a general ruling, not restricted to one accident over another, even if the genera of accidents differed. There must be a comprehensive reality and a distinguishing reality. This is the case with the issue we mentioned concerning those who affirmed what we affirmed and those who denied it.

### [The Goal of the Verifiers in Sensible Forms (مطلوب المحققين في الصور المحسة)]

The goal of the People of Verification (المحققين) is not the sensible forms, whether pronunciation or script. Rather, the goal is the meanings contained within that script or that pronunciation, and the reality of the word and the inscribed thing itself. For the observer of forms is spiritual, so he cannot depart from his genus.

Do not be veiled by seeing that the dead person does not seek bread due to the absence of the spiritual secret in him, while the living person seeks it due to the presence of the spirit in him, and then say, "We see him seeking something other than his genus." Know that in bread, water, and all foods, drinks, clothes, and gatherings, there are subtle, strange spirits (أرواح لطيفة غريبة) which are the secret of its life, its knowledge, its glorification of its Lord, and the loftiness of its rank in the Presence of witnessing its Creator. Those spirits are a trust (أمانة) with these sensible forms, which they deliver to this spirit deposited in the body (الشبح).

Do you not see how some of them deliver their trust to it, which is the secret of life? When it delivers its trust to it, it exits either through the path it entered, in which case it is called vomit (قيئا) or regurgitation (قلسا), or through another path, in which case it is called feces (‘adhira) or urine (bawl). The first name was only given to it because of the secret it delivered to the spirit, and it remains with another name, which the owner of the vegetables and the managers of the causes of transformations seek it for. Thus, it turns over in the stages of existence, becoming naked and clothed, revolving in the cycle of the sphere like a waterwheel, until Allah, the All-Knowing, the Wise, wills.

The spirit is excused in its passionate love (تعشقه) for these sensible things, for it has witnessed its object of desire within them; they are in the dwelling of its Beloved.

> I pass by the dwellings, the dwellings of Salmā,
> I kiss this wall and that wall.
> And it is not the love of the dwellings that occupies my heart,
> But the love of the one who dwells in the dwellings.

And Abū Isḥāq al-Zawālī (may Allah have mercy on him) said:

> O dwelling, a gazelle in you has captivated me,
> May Allah bless you for what you contain, O dwelling!
> If I were to complain to it of the love of its dweller,
> Then I would see the structure of the dwelling collapse.

So understand—may Allah grant us and you understanding—the secrets of His words, and grant us and you insight into the hidden aspects of the secrets of His wisdom.

### [Meanings of the World of Letters (معاني عالم الحروف)]

As for the statement we mentioned after every letter, I wish to clarify it for you so that you may know from it what will not repel you from that which you do not know. The lowest degree of the Path (الطريق) is submission (التسليم) regarding what you do not know, and the highest is the certainty (القطع) of its truthfulness. Anything outside these two stations (المقامين) is deprivation, just as the one characterized by these two stations is felicitous. Abu Yazid al-Bistami said to Abu Musa: "O Abu Musa, if you meet a believer in the discourse of the people of this Way (الطريقة), tell him to pray for you, for his prayer is answered." Ruwaym said: "Whoever sits with the Sufis and contradicts them in anything they realize (يتحققون به), God removes the light of faith (نور الايمان) from his heart."

[Explanation] Thus, our statement that a certain letter, by its name as I have presented it, belongs to the World of the Unseen (عالم الغيب)—know that the World (العالم), according to one of our classifications based on a known reality, is divided into two sections:

**A section called the World of the Unseen (عالم الغيب)**, which is everything hidden from the senses and which the senses are not accustomed to perceive. This includes the letters Sīn, Ṣād, Kāf, the dotted Khā’, Tā’ with two dots above, Fā’, Shīn, Hā’, Thā’ with three dots, and Ḥā’. These are the letters of Mercy (الرحمة), Kindness (الألطاف), Compassion (الرأفة), Tenderness (الحنان), Tranquility (السكينة), Dignity (الوقار), Descent (النزول), and Humility (التواضع). Concerning them, this verse was revealed: <<وَعِبَادُ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الَّذِينَ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ هَوْنًا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ الْجَاهِلُونَ قَالُوا سَلَامًا>> (And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace). And concerning them, it was also revealed, through the Muhammadan Reality (الحقيقة المحمدية) which extends to them from him, due to his being granted the comprehensive words (جوامع الكلم), that their Messenger came to them with it, so the Exalted said: <<وَالْكَاظِمِينَ الْغَيْظَ وَالْعَافِينَ عَنِ النَّاسِ>> (And those who restrain anger and pardon the people). And concerning them: <<وَقُلُوبُهُمْ وَجِلَةٌ>> (And their hearts are fearful). And concerning them: <<الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي صَلَاتِهِمْ خَاشِعُونَ>> (Those who in their prayers are humbly submissive). And concerning them: <<وَخَشَعَتِ الْأَصْوَاتُ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ>> (And [all] voices shall be humbled before the Most Merciful). This category of letters is also what we say belongs to Kindness (اللطف) for the reasons mentioned. This is part of the meanings by which we designate it the World of the Unseen and Kindness (عالم الغيب واللطف).

**The other section is called the World of Witnessing and Domination (عالم الشهادة والقهر)**. This is every world among the two worlds of letters that people are accustomed to perceiving with their senses, comprising the remaining letters. Concerning them is His saying, the Exalted: <<فَاصْدَعْ بِمَا تُؤْمَرُ>> (Therefore, proclaim what you are commanded). And His saying, the Exalted: <<وَاغْلُظْ عَلَيْهِمْ>> (And be harsh upon them). And His saying: <<وَأَجْلِبْ عَلَيْهِمْ بِخَيْلِكَ وَرَجِلِكَ>> (And assault them with your cavalry and your infantry). This is the world of Sovereignty (الملك), Authority (السلطان), Domination (القهر), Severity (الشدة), Struggle (الجهاد), Confrontation (المصادمة), and Combat (المقارعة). From the spirituality (روحانية) of these letters comes to the recipient of revelation (صاحب الوحي) the groaning (الغط), the sound of the bell (صلصلة الجرس), and the sweating of the brow (رشح الجبين). For them are the verses: <<يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُزَّمِّلُ>> (O you who wraps himself [in clothing]) and <<يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُدَّثِّرُ>> (O you who covers himself [with a garment]). Just as concerning the letters of the World of the Unseen: <<نَزَلَ بِهِ الرُّوحُ الْأَمِينُ * عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ لِتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُنذِرِينَ * لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِ * وَلَا تَعْجَلْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مِن قَبْلِ أَن يُقْضَىٰ إِلَيْكَ وَحْيُهُ * وَقُل رَّبِّ زِدْنِي عِلْمًا>> (The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down * upon your heart, [O Muhammad] – that you may be one of the warners. * Do not move your tongue with it to hasten it. * And do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur’an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge").

As for our statement concerning the Sovereignty (الملك), the Omnipotence (الجبروت), or the Dominion (الملكوت), its mention has preceded at the beginning of this chapter when we spoke of the levels (مراتب) of the letters. As for our statement regarding its place of articulation (مخرجه), this is known to the reciters (القراء). Its benefit for us is that you may know its celestial spheres (أفلاكه). For the sphere (الفلك) that God made the cause for the existence of a certain letter is not the same sphere from which another letter originated. Even if the sphere is the same, the cycle (الدورة) is not identical, considering the estimation you impose upon something whose reality necessitates that estimation. There will be a distinguishing feature within the sphere, separate from the sphere itself, which you take as a marker at the point of estimation and observe. When that marker returns to the limit of the initial estimation, the cycle has ended and another has begun.

The Prophet, peace be upon him, said:
"Time has completed its cycle and returned to the state it was in on the day God created it."
The explanation of this hadith will come in the eleventh chapter of this book.

As for our statement regarding its number being such-and-such, or such-and-such without such-and-such, this is what some people call the Greater Sum (الجزم الكبير) and the Lesser Sum (الجزم الصغير), or sometimes they call it the Total (الجمل) instead of the Sum. This has a wondrous secret in the spheres of the wandering stars (أفلاك الدراري) and the spheres of the constellations (أفلاك البروج). Their names are known to people. They assign the Greater Sum to the sphere of the constellations, subtracting the accumulated number twenty-eight by twenty-eight. They assign the Lesser Sum to the spheres of the wandering stars, subtracting its number nine by nine, according to a method that is not the subject of this book, and a science that is not our objective.

### [The Benefit of Numbers according to the Realizers (المحققين)]

The benefit of the numbers for us, in our Path (طريقنا) by which our felicity is perfected, is that when the Realizer (المحقق) or the seeker (المريد) takes one of these letters, he adds the Lesser Sum (الجزم الصغير) to the Greater Sum (الجزم الكبير). For example, he adds to the Qāf, which is one hundred by the Greater Sum and one by the Lesser Sum. He always takes the number of the Lesser Sum, which ranges from one to nine, and returns it to its Essence (ذاته). If it is one, which is the letter Alif by both sums, and Qāf, Shīn, and Yā’—and according to others, the dotted Ghayn instead of Shīn by the Lesser Sum—he makes that one the subtle reality (لطيفته) sought from it, by whichever sum it may be. If it is the Alif, up to the Ṭā’, which are the simple numbers (بسائط الأعداد), they are shared between the Greater and Lesser Sums. Insofar as it belongs to the Lesser Sum, it is returned to you; and insofar as it belongs to the Greater Sum, it is returned to the spiritual influxes (الواردات) sought by you. Thus, in the Alif, which is the one, you seek the Yā’ of ten, the Qāf of one hundred, and the Shīn or Ghayn of one thousand, according to the difference of opinion. The levels (مراتب) of number are completed, the circumference (المحيط) is finished, and the cycle returns to its beginning. There are only four points: East, West, Zenith (استواء), and Nadir (حضيض)—four quarters. The number four is a comprehensive number (عدد محيط) because it is the sum of the simple numbers, just as these knots are the sum of the compound numbers.

And if it is two, which is the Bā’ by both sums, and the Kāf and Rā’ by the Lesser Sum, you make the Bā’ your state (حالك) and confront it with the World of the Unseen and the World of Witnessing (عالم الغيب والشهادة). You then stand upon their secrets, which are nothing but Unseen and Witnessing—namely, the Essence (الذات) and the Attributes (الصفات) in the Divine realm (الإلهيات), and the cause and the effect in the natural realm (الطبيعيات), but not in the intellectual realm (العقليات), and the condition and the conditioned in the intellectual and legal realms (الشرعيات), but not in the natural realm, though it is in the Divine realm.
